en: Essay winner Ìlọ̀rí Ayọ̀olúwa of Mater Christi Catholic Girls' High School, Igede Èkìtì, Èkìtì State, recalls the first time she encountered radio at the age 5:
yor: Olúborí ìdíje àròkọ Ìlọ̀rí Olúwatóbi ti iléèwé Mater Christi Catholic Girls' High School, Ìgede Èkìtì, Ìpínlẹ̀ Èkìtì, mú u wá sí ìrántí ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ tí òùn-ún ṣalábàápàdée rédíò nígbà tí òùn-ún wà ní ọmọ ọdún 5:
mt0: <pad> Ìlọ̀rí Ayọ̀olúwa of Mater Christi Catholic Girls' High School, Igede Èkìtì, Èkìtì State recalls the first time she encountered radio at the age of five.</s>

en: I think I was 5 years old when I got my first radio.
yor: Ó dà bí ẹni pé ọmọ ọdún 5 ni mí nígbà tí mo kọ́kọ́ ní ẹ̀rọ-ìgbóhùnsáfẹ́fẹ́ẹ̀ mi.
mt0: <pad> I think I was 5 years old when I got my first radio.</s>

en: I fiddled with a few buttons and it came on.
yor: Mo tẹ àwọn ohun-àtẹ̀-àṣẹ ara rẹ̀, ó sì tàn.
mt0: <pad> Emi o si fi awọn bọtini diẹ sii ati pe o ti tan.</s>

en: Then I was astonished to hear voices resonating from this "box" and thought there were people trapped in it.
yor: Ìyàlẹ́nu ló jẹ́ fún mi bí mo ṣe ń gbọ́ ohùn tí ó ń ti inúu "àpótí" yìí jáde tí mo sì rò wípé àwọn èèyàn ló wà nínúu rẹ̀.
mt0: <pad> Ati pe mo nireti lati gbọ́ awọn ohun ti o n jade lati "apoti" yii ati pe mo ro pe awọn eniyan ti o wa ninu rẹ̀.</s>

en: I got scared and asked my father what it was and he took his time to explain what a radio was to me.
yor: Ẹ̀rú bá mi mo sì béèrè lọ́wọ́ọ bàbáà mi ohun tí ó jẹ́, ó sì ṣàlàyé ohun tí rédíò jẹ́ fún mi.
mt0: <pad> I was afraid and asked my father what it was and he took his time to explain what a radio was to me.</s>

en: On February 12, secondary school pupils, students of mass communication, ace broadcasters and key personnel from the media industry as well as everyday radio fans converged on the Lekki Coliseum in Lagos for a symposium to talk about the importance of radio for development.
yor: Ní ọjọ́ 12 oṣù Èrèlé, àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ilé ẹ̀kọ́ gíga, akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ìmọ̀ iṣẹ́ ìròyìn, ọ̀jẹ̀ sọ̀rọ̀sọ̀rọ̀ àti àwọn alẹ́nulọ́rọ̀ nínú iṣẹ́ ìròyìn àti àwọn olólùfẹ́ẹ̀ rédíò péjúpésẹ̀ sí Lekki Coliseum ní Èkó fún àpérò láti jíròrò nípa pàtàkìi ẹ̀rọ-ìgbóhùnsáfẹ́fẹ́ fún ìdàgbàsókè.
mt0: <pad> Òun kò mọ́</s>

en: On February 12, secondary school pupils, students of mass communication, ace broadcasters and key personnel from the media industry as well as everyday radio fans converged on the Lekki Coliseum in Lagos for a symposium to talk about the importance of radio for development.
yor: Ní ọjọ́ 12 oṣù Èrèlé, àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ilé ẹ̀kọ́ gíga, akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ìmọ̀ iṣẹ́ ìròyìn, ọ̀jẹ̀ sọ̀rọ̀sọ̀rọ̀ àti àwọn alẹ́nulọ́rọ̀ nínú iṣẹ́ ìròyìn àti àwọn olólùfẹ́ẹ̀ rédíò péjúpésẹ̀ sí Lekki Coliseum ní Èkó fún àpérò láti jíròrò nípa pàtàkìi ẹ̀rọ-ìgbóhùnsáfẹ́fẹ́ fún ìdàgbàsókè.
mt0: <pad> Òun kò mọ́</s>

en: Photo by Ọmọ Yoòbá, used with permission.
yor: Àwòrán láti ọwọ́ọ Ọmọ Yoòbá, a gba àṣẹ láti lò ó.
mt0: <pad> Image by Omo Yoruba, used with permission.</s>

en: When the sun went down, veteran broadcasters, representatives of the Oba of Lagos, Ọ̀túnba Gani Adams, the Ààrẹ Ọ̀nà Kakanfò of Yorùbá-land and other guests and dignitaries mingled at the Lekki Coliseum for the World Radio Day award ceremony and dinner.
yor: Ní ìgbàtí ọjọ́ rọ̀, àwọn ògbóǹtarìgì sọ̀rọ̀sọ̀rọ̀, àwọn aṣojú the Ọba Èkó, Ọ̀túnba Gani Adams, Ààrẹ Ọ̀nà Kakanfò ilẹ̀ẹ Yorùbá àti àwọn àlejò mìíràn péjọ sí Lekki Coliseum fún àpèjẹ alẹ́ àti ìfàmìẹ̀yẹ dánilọ́lá Àyájọ́ Ọjọ́ Ẹ̀rọ-ìgbóhùnsáfẹ́fẹ́ Àgbáyé.
mt0: <pad> When the sun went down, veteran broadcasters, representatives of the Oba of Lagos, Ọ̀túnba Gani Adams, the Ààrẹ Ọnà Kakanfò of Yorùbá-land and other guests and dignitaries mingled at the Lekki Coliseum for the World Radio Day award ceremony and dinner.</s>

en: Top broadcast professionals like Cordelia Okpei and a host of others graced the event.
yor: Àwọn àgbà ọ̀jẹ̀ẹ sọ̀rọ̀sọ̀rọ̀ bíi Cordelia Okpei àti àwọn tó kù wá sí ayẹyẹ náà.
mt0: <pad> Ṣe o mọ ọ?</s>

en: Some deserving persons were presented with awards of recognition for their contributions to the development of the broadcast industry and service to humanity.
yor: Àmì-ẹ̀yẹ̀ẹ̀ fún akíkanjú lẹ́nu iṣẹ́ àti ìṣiṣẹ́sìnlú lọ sí ọ̀dọ̀ àwọn ẹni tí ó tọ́ sí.
mt0: <pad> Awọn ẹni ti o yẹ lati gba awọn ẹri ìmọ̀lẹ̀ fún àwọn iṣẹ́ wọn nínú ìgbésẹ̀ ìṣètò ìròyìn àti ìṣẹ́ ìjọba.</s>

en: The series of events culminated in an on-air phone-in programme, whereby listeners made phone calls to say “happy World Radio Day” in their diverse range of languages and tongues:
yor: Ọ̀kan-ò-jọ̀kan ètò náà wá sópin pẹ̀lú ìṣójú òpó sílẹ̀ láti gba ìpè àwọn olùgbọ́ wọlé sórí afẹ́fẹ́, níbi tí wọ́n ti ní kí àwọn ènìyàn ó sọ wípé “ẹ kú Àyájọ́ Ọjọ́ Ẹ̀rọ-ìgbóhùnsáfẹ́fẹ́ Àgbáyé” ní àwọn onírúurú ọ̀kan-ò-jọ̀kan èdè àti ahọ́n:
mt0: <pad> Ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìgbàlódé náà sọ́n ní ìfẹ̀ sí ìsègùn lórí ọ̀rọ̀, níbi tí àwọn àgbọ́rùnbá ti ń pè lórí ọ̀rọ̀ láti sọ “Ọjọ́ Ayé Ẹ̀kọ́ Ìlú Radio” ní ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn èdè àti èdè.</s>

en: No one was left out of the celebration. Voices of some of the Global Voices Lingua teams were also broadcast on Metro 97.7FM. Some retired broadcasters were invited to read the news or anchor a segment.
yor: Kò sẹ́ni tí kò kópa nínú ayẹyẹ náà. Ohùn àwọn ikọ̀ Ohùn Àgbáyé náà bọ́ sórí afẹ́fẹ́ ní orí ìkànnì Metro 97.7FM. Àwọn sọ̀rọ̀sọ̀rọ̀ tí ó ti fẹ̀yìntì ló ka ìròyìn tí wọ́n sì tọ́kùn ètò.
mt0: <pad> Ẹnikẹni kò yíò sílẹ̀ nínú ayẹyẹ náà. Àwọn ìgbìmọ̀ Global Voices Lingua àwọn ètò náà ni wọ́n tun ṣe lórí Metro 97.7 FM. Àwọn ìgbìmọ̀ ìrìnnà lọ́wọ́ ti a pe láti ka iroyin tàbí jẹ́ kí wọn sọ̀rọ̀ àwọn ìròyìn.</s>

en: Radio Nigeria World Radio Day 2020 is the maiden edition of such events but radio practitioners and advocates expect it to become an annual celebration.
yor: Àkọ́kọ́ irú ‘ẹ̀ ni Àyájọ́ Ọjọ́ Ẹ̀rọ-ìgbóhùnsáfẹ́fẹ́ Rédíò Orílẹ̀-èdèe Nàìjíríà ọdún-un 2020 àmọ́ àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ àti olólùfẹ́ẹ̀ rédíò lérò wípé ayẹyẹ náà yóò máa wáyé lọ́dọọdún.
mt0: <pad> World Radio Day 2020 is the first edition of such events but radio practitioners and advocates expect it to become an annual celebration.</s>

en: This chief hopes Yorùbá speakers adopt his newly invented 'talking alphabet'
yor: Olóyè yìí nírètí wí pé àwọn ọmọ Yorùbá yóò tẹ́wọ́ gba 'alífábẹ́ẹ̀tì t'ó ń sọ̀rọ̀ ' tí òun hu ìmọ̀ rẹ̀
mt0: <pad> Òun ní ìfẹ́ láti jẹ́ kí Yorùbá speakers adopt his newly invented 'talking alphabet'.</s>

en: Will the new Yorùbá orthography become mainstream in the future?
yor: Ǹjẹ́ ìlànà ìṣọwọ́kọ Yorùbá tuntun yóò di lílò lọ́jọ́ iwájú bí?
mt0: <pad> Ṣe awọn ọmọ Yoruba titun yoo di mainstream ni ọjọ iwaju?</s>

en: Chief Tolúlàṣẹ Ògúntósìn stands next to the paramount king of Yorùbáland, the Ọọ̀ni of Ifẹ̀, seated.
yor: Olóyè Tolúlàṣẹ Ògúntósìn dúró lẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́ ọba ilẹ̀-Yorùbá káàfàtà, Ọọ̀ni ti Ilé-Ifẹ̀, lórí ìjókòó.
mt0: <pad> Chief Tolúlàṣẹ Ògúntósìn stands next to the paramount king of Yorùbáland, the Ọọ̀ni of Ifẹ̀, seated.</s>

en: Photo courtesy of Chief  Ògúntósìn.
yor: Olóyè Ògúntósìn ló yànda àwòrán.
mt0: <pad> Image courtesy of Chief Oguntosin</s>

en: In the wake of the International Year of Indigenous Languages in 2019 and the International Decade of Indigenous Languages 2022-2032, many Africans have started to take a wide range of actions to advance African languages.
yor: Lẹ́yìn ìpolongo kárí ayé nípa Ọdún Èdè Ìbílẹ̀ Àgbáyé ní ọdún 2019 àti ìkéde Ọdún mẹ́wàá Èdè Ìbílẹ̀ Àgbáyé 2022-2032, púpọ̀ nínú àwọn ọmọ Ilẹ̀-Adúláwọ̀ ló ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ ọ̀kan-ò-jọ̀kan àkànṣe iṣẹ́ tó ní ṣe pẹ̀lú ìdàgbàsókè àwọn èdè Ilẹ̀-Adúláwọ̀.
mt0: <pad> Ní ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ọdún àgbáyé ti èdè àwọn ará Afirika ni 2019 àti ọdún àgbáyé ti èdè àwọn ara Afirika 2022-2032, ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ará Afirika ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ láti ṣe ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ìgbésẹ̀ láti ṣe àtúnse èdè àwọn ara Afirika.</s>

en: Writing the Yorùbá language in the borrowed Latin script may soon become a thing of the past as one Yorùbá man, Chief Tolúlàṣẹ Ògúntósìn, based in Benin, West Africa, has invented a writing system to encode the Yorùbá language.
yor: Lílo àyálò ìlànà Látíìnì fún kíkọ èdè Yorùbá yóò di àfìsẹ́yìn tí eégún aláré ń fiṣọ láì pẹ́ ní èyí tí ọmọ Káàárọ̀-o-ò-jí-ire kan, Olóyè Tolúlàṣẹ Ògúntósìn, ẹni tí ó ń gbé ní Ilẹ̀ Olómìnira Bẹ̀nẹ̀, Ìwọ̀-oòrùn Ilẹ̀-Adúláwọ̀, ti hu ìmọ̀ ìlànà tí a ó máa lò fún kíkọ èdè Yorùbá.
mt0: <pad> Writing the Yoruba language in the borrowed Latin script may soon become a thing of the past as one Yoruba man, Chief Tolúlàṣẹ Ògúntósìn, based in Benin, West Africa, has invented a writing system to encode the Yoruba language.</s>

en: The newly invented Yorùbá alphabet is making waves in the hopes that it could replace Latin script used for over 100 years.
yor: Alífábẹ́ẹ̀tì Yorùbá tuntun náà ti ń gbàlú kan pẹ̀lú ìrètí wí pé yóò pààrọ ti Látíìnì tí ó ti jẹ́ lílò fún ọgọ́rùn-ún ọdún àti jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ.
mt0: <pad> The newly invented Yorùbá alphabet is making waves in the hopes that it could replace Latin script used for over 100 years.</s>

en: The distinct alphabet came to him through divine inspiration in his dreams, according to Chief Ògúntósìn in a Whatsapp interview with Global Voices.
yor: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí Olóyè Ògúntósìn ti ṣe rò fún Ohùn Àgbáyé nínú ìfọ̀rọ̀wánilẹ́nuwò lórí WhatsApp, ojú àlá ni alífábẹ́ẹ̀tì àràmàndà wọ̀nyí ti f'ara hàn sí òun.
mt0: <pad> Ògúntòsìn sọ pé ìmọ̀ àgbéjáde ìwé ìyí nípasè ìdánwò ọlọ́run nínú ìrìnnà rẹ̀, o sì sọ pé kò mọ̀.</s>

en: He now travels across Yorùbáland — spanning Benin to Nigeria — to promote his "talking alphabet" as sent to him by his ancestors.
yor: Ní báyìí, níṣe ni ó máa ń ṣe ìrìnàjò jákèjádò Ilẹ̀-Yorùbá — láti Bẹ̀nẹ̀ títí dé Nàìjíríà — láti polongo "alífábẹ́ẹ̀tì tí ó ń sọ̀rọ̀ " rẹ̀ bí àwọn alálẹ̀ ti ṣe fi rán an.
mt0: <pad> He now travels across Yorubaland — stretching from Benin to Nigeria — to promote his "talking alphabet" as sent to him by his ancestors.</s>

en: Chief Ògúntósìn believes that this alphabet was used by Odùduwà, the father of the Yorùbá people, in ancient times — but was lost.
yor: Olóyè Ògúntósìn nígbàgbọ́ wí pé Odùduwà, tí ó jẹ́ bàbá-ńlá ìran Yorùbá lo alífábẹ́ẹ̀tì náà ní ayé àtijọ́ — àmọ́ ó ti di ohun ìgbàgbé.
mt0: <pad> Chief Oguntosin believes that this alphabet was used by Odùduwà, the father of the Yoruba people, in ancient times — but was lost.</s>

en: There are 25 symbols in all.
yor: 25 ni gbogbo àwọn àmì wọ̀nyí lápapọ̀.
mt0: <pad> Ṣe 25 símimọ́ ní gbogbo.</s>

en: African linguists assert that if Africa is to grow, it must have its own orthographies or writing systems.
yor: Àwọn onímọ̀ nípa èdè ní Ilẹ̀-Adúláwọ̀ sọ wí pé kí ìlọsíwájú ó tó dé bá Ilẹ̀ Adúláwọ̀, ó pọn dandan kí ó ní ìlànà ìṣọwọ́ kọ èdè tàbí ìlànà kíkọ tí ó jẹ́ tirẹ̀.
mt0: <pad> Òun kò mọ̀.</s>

en: A civilized and ancient Niger-Congo language like Yorùbá should not rely on a borrowed orthography to encode its thoughts and philosophy.
yor: Èdè tí ó wà lábẹ́ ìsọ̀rí Niger-Congo tí ó jẹ́ èdè ìran tí ó ti wà lọ́jọ́ tó ti pẹ́ tí ó sì lajú bí èdè Yorùbá ò gbọdọ̀ gbọ́kàn tẹ ìlànà àyálò fún kíkọ èrò àti ìmọ̀ ìrírí ayé rẹ̀.
mt0: <pad> A civilized and ancient Niger-Congo language like Yorùbá should not rely on a borrowed orthography to encode its thoughts and philosophy.</s>

en: Read more: Yorùbá loan words: How languages evolve
yor: Kà sí i: Ọ̀rọ̀ àyálò nínú èdè Yorùbá: Bí èdè ṣe yí padà
mt0: <pad> Yoruba loan words: How languages evolve</s>

en: In 1843, Reverend Samuel Àjàyí Crowther of the Christian Missionary Society developed the Yorùbá orthography by adopting Latin script with diacritics — or accent marks.
yor: Ní ọdún 1843, Àlùfáà Sámúẹ́lì Àjàyí Crowther òṣìṣẹ́ Ẹgbẹ́ Iṣẹ́ Ìránṣẹ́ Ẹ̀sìn Ìgbàgbọ́ (CMS) ṣe àgbékalẹ̀ ìlànà ìṣọwọ́kọ èdè Yorùbá nípa yíya ìlànà Látíìnì lò pẹ̀lú àfikún àwọn àmì ohùn — tàbí àmì ìró ọ̀rọ̀.
mt0: <pad> In 1843, Reverend Samuel Àjàyí Crowther of the Christian Missionary Society developed the Yorùbá orthography by adopting Latin script with diacritics — or accent marks.</s>

en: Ever since, thousands of books have been published in Yorùbá using Latin script instead of Ajami, an Arabic script used before 1843 to write in West African Indigenous languages such as Yorùbá and Hausa.
yor: Láti ìgbà náà, ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún ìwé ti jẹ́ títẹ̀ jáde ní èdè Yorùbá nípasẹ̀ lílo ìlànà kíkọ Látíìnì dípò Ajami, tí í ṣe ìlànà ìṣọwọ́kọ Lárúbáwá tí ó ti jẹ́ lílò tẹ́lẹ̀tẹ́lẹ́ rí fún kíkọ èdè Ìwọ̀-oòrùn Ilẹ̀-Adúláwọ̀ bí i èdè Yorùbá àti Haúsá kí ó tó di 1843.
mt0: <pad> Ever since, thousands of books have been published in Yoruba using Latin script instead of Ajami, an Arabic script used before 1843 to write in West African Indigenous languages such as Yoruba and Hausa.</s>

en: Some language advocates contend that using Latin, a foreign script, to encode African languages, keeps the continent in an enslaved mindset.
yor: Àwọn alágbàwí èdè gbà wí pé lílo ìlànà Látíìnì, tí ó jẹ́ ìṣọwọ́kọ láti ilẹ̀ òkèèrè, fún kíkọ àwọn èdè Ilẹ̀-Adúláwọ̀ sílẹ̀, fi ilẹ̀ náà sínú ipò ẹrú.
mt0: <pad> Some language advocates contend that using Latin, a foreign script, to encode African languages keeps the continent in an enslaved mindset.</s>

en: Instilling this new writing system follows a history of ancient writing systems in Africa, like Egyptian hieroglyphics, the Adrinka collection of the Akan tribe of Ghana, Ethiopian Ge'ez, the Nsibidi ideographic script of West Central Africa which date back to 5000 BC, as well as Vai alphabet scripts are of African origin.
yor: Ìpolongo ìlànà ìṣọwọ́kọ tuntun yìí wáyé ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú àwọn ìṣọwọ́kọ ayébáyé Ilẹ̀-Adúláwọ̀, bí i hieroglyphics ti Íjípìtì, Àkójọ Adrinka ti ìran Akan ní Ghana, Ge'ez ti Ethiopia, ìṣọwọ́kọ ìyàwòrán Nsibidi ti Àárín Gbùngbùn Ìwọ̀-oòrùn Ilẹ̀-Adúláwọ̀ tí ó ti wà fún bí 5000 ọdún k'á tó bí Jésù, àti alífábẹ́ẹ̀tì Vai ni Ilẹ̀-Adúláwọ̀ jẹ́ orísun wọn.
mt0: <pad> Ṣiṣeto awọn ọna kika tuntun yii tẹle itan ti awọn ọna kika atijọ ni Afirika, bii hieroglyphics Egyptian, awọn ọpọlọpọ Adrinka ti awọn Akan ẹgbẹ ti Ghana, Geez Ethiopian, Nsibidi ideographic script of West Central Africa which date back to 5000 BC, ati Vai alphabet scripts are of African origin.</s>

en: Divining a 'talking alphabet'
yor: Ìṣàyèwò 'alífábẹ́ẹ̀tì tó ń sọ̀rọ̀ '
mt0: <pad> Ṣe awọn 'ọrọ ìmọ̀lẹ̀ àlàyé'.</s>

en: Global Voices Yorùbá Lingua Manager Ọmọ Yoòbá interviewed Chief Ògúntósìn, via WhatsApp voice note messaging, to learn more about how he discovered this new alphabet.
yor: Alákòóso Ohùn Àgbáyé lédè Yorùbá, Ọmọ Yoòbá fi ọ̀rọ̀ wá Olóyè Ògúntósìn lẹ́nu wò, nípasẹ̀ iṣẹ́-ìjẹ́ ohùn lórí ẹ̀rọ iìtàkùrọ̀sọ WhatsApp, láti mọ̀ sí i nípa bí ó ti ṣe rí alífábẹ́ẹ̀tì tuntun yìí.
mt0: <pad> Global Voices Yoruba Lingua Manager Ọmọ Yoòbá interviewed Chief Oguntosin, via WhatsApp voice note messaging, to learn more about how he discovered this new alphabet.</s>

en: Chief Ògúntósìn, now 43, explained that after the demise of his father in 1997, he had to care for his siblings as the oldest son and could not further his education after completing secondary school.
yor: Olóyè Ògúntósìn, tó jẹ́ ọmọ ọdún 43 báyìí, ṣàlàyé wí pé òun kò lè ka ju ilé gíga lọ lẹ́yìn ìpapòdà bàbá òun ní ọdún 1997, tí òun sì ní láti ṣe ojúṣe bí bàbá gẹ́gẹ́ bí àkọ́bí láti tọ́jú àwọn àbúrò rẹ̀.
mt0: <pad> Chief Oguntosin, now 43, said that after his father died in 1997, he had to look after his siblings as the oldest son and could not continue his education after completing secondary school.</s>

en: However, as a Yorùbá chief, he focused his cultural work on uniting the seven grandchildren of Odùduwa, serving as a mediator.
yor: Síbẹ̀, bí olóyè Yorùbá tí ó jẹ́, iṣẹ́ ìgbélárugẹ àṣà rẹ̀ dá lórí ìṣọ̀kan àwọn ọmọ Odùduwà jẹ́ ohun tí ó gbé e lọ́kàn gidi gan-an, tí ó sì ń ṣe bí olùlàjà láàárín wọn.
mt0: <pad> However, as a Yorùbá chief, he focused his cultural work on uniting the seven grandchildren of Odùduwa, serving as a mediator.</s>

en: As his cultural integration work progressed, however, he wanted to achieve more.
yor: Bí iṣẹ́ ìgbélárugẹ àṣà yìí ṣe ń gbòòrò sí i, kò tẹ́ ẹ lọ́rùn tó bí ó ṣe fẹ́.
mt0: <pad> Ṣugbọn bi iṣẹ́ rẹ̀ ti ṣe ìṣọ́pọ̀ àṣá rẹ̀ si lọ, ṣùgbọ́n ó fẹ́ láti ṣe diẹ̀ nínú rẹ̀.</s>

en: In 2011, he approached a babaláwo or “diviner” of Ifa, the Yorùbá god of wisdom.
yor: Lọ́dún 2011, ó fi eéjì kún eéjì, ó fi ẹẹ́ta kún ẹẹ̀ta, ó gba oko aláwo lọ.
mt0: <pad> In 2011, he approached a babaláwo or “diviner” of Ifa, the Yoruba god of wisdom.</s>

en: The diviner, Olókun Awópẹ̀tu, told him to visit his ancestral shrine within the Farasinmi community in Badagry, Lagos State, Nigeria, and to take whatever he came into contact with at the shrine.
yor: Babaláwo náà, Olókun Awópẹ̀tu, wí fún un pé kí ó lọ sí ojúbọ ìdílé rẹ̀ tí ó wà ní agbègbè Farasìnmí ní Àgbádárìgì (Badagry), Ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó, orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, wí pé yóò rí atọ́nà tí yóò tọ́ka sí ohun tí Elédùmarè rán an wá ṣe láyé ní ojúbọ náà.
mt0: <pad> Olókun Awópẹ̀tu, a diviner, told him to visit his ancestral shrine within the Farasinmi community in Badagry, Lagos State, Nigeria, and to take whatever he came into contact with at the shrine.</s>

en: There, he found a “strange object” that he took with him back to Porto-Novo, Benin.
yor: Ní ojúbọ náà, ó rí “nǹkan àjèjì” kan tí ó mú padà sí ilé rẹ̀ ní Porto-Novo, Bẹ̀nẹ̀.
mt0: <pad> Òun rí ohun "ìyàtọ̀" nibẹ̀, ó si gbé lọ sí Porto-Novo, Benin.</s>

en: When he arrived, the house was completely dark.
yor: Nígbà tí ó délé, òkùnkùn bo iyàrá birimùbirimù.
mt0: <pad> When he arrived, the house was completely dark.</s>

en: With no light bulbs in the living room, he usually relied on light emitted from the rays of the TV screen.
yor: Kò sí iná amọ́roro nínú yàrá ìgbàlejò, ìmọ́lẹ̀ ìtànṣán ẹ̀rọ àmóhùnmáwòrán ni ó máa ń fi ríran.
mt0: <pad> Without light bulbs in the living room, he usually relied on the light emitted from the rays of the TV screen.</s>

en: He placed the object on the table and switched on the TV, only to discover, surprisingly, that the object he placed on the table had disappeared.
yor: Ó gbé nǹkan àjèjì náà sí orí àga ìgbénǹkanlé, ó sì tan ẹ̀rọ àmóhùnmáwòrán, kàyéfì ló jẹ́ fún un, ohun tí ó gbé sórí àga di àwátì.
mt0: <pad> O fi nkan naa silẹ lori tabili o si tan TV, nikan lati rii daju, ni iyalẹnu, pe nkan naa ti o fi silẹ lori tabili ti parun.</s>

en: He turned the entire room upside down and finally found it in a corner of the house.
yor: Ó tú gbogbo ilé kí ó tó wá rí i ní kọ̀rọ̀ ilé.
mt0: <pad> O yí gbogbo àgbáyé sí ìsìn àti ní ìgbà kan náà ó rí i ní apá kan àwọn ilé.</s>

en: That night, he slept with the object under his pillow. He told Global Voices:
yor: Lálẹ́ ọjọ́ yẹn, ó fi nǹkan àjèjì náà sábẹ́ ìgbèrí sùn. Ó sọ fún Ohùn Àgbáyé:
mt0: <pad> Àwọn ọjọ́ yìí, ó sùn pẹ̀lú ohun náà lábẹ́ àṣà. O sọ fún Global Voices pé ó mọ̀.</s>

en: I had a dream that I visited the sun.
yor: Mo lálàá wí pé mo lọ sí inú oòrùn.
mt0: <pad> I dreamed that I visited the sun.</s>

en: When I got to the sun, it was dark and I was shown the alphabet in the form of lightning.
yor: Nígbà tí mo débẹ̀, ó òkùnkùn ṣú bolẹ̀, a sì fi alífábẹ́ẹ̀tì náà hàn mí ní àpẹẹrẹ ìmọ́lẹ̀.
mt0: <pad> When I got to the sun, it was dark and I was shown the alphabet in the form of lightning.</s>

en: Every time I slept, I had similar dreams, going from planet to planet, teaching people how to use the script...
yor: Ìgbàkúùgbà tí mo bá sùn, àlá yìí kan náà ni ní ọ̀nà àrà, mò ń lọ láti agbègbè kan sí agbègbè mìíràn, tí mo sì ń kọ́ àwọn ènìyàn bí a ti ṣe ń lo ìṣọwọ́kọ tuntun náà...
mt0: <pad> Òóòóò ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè ìí ñí àáëè

en: For three years, he kept dreaming about the alphabet, seeing visions consecutively, yet he did nothing about it.
yor: Fún ọdún mẹ́ta, kò yé lálàá nípa alífábẹ́ẹ̀tì náà, kò yé ríran léraléra, síbẹ̀ kò ṣe nǹkankan sí i.
mt0: <pad> Òun sì mọ̀ pé o ní ìrírí àwọn ìwé ìdárayá, ó si rí ìwé ìdárayá lọ́pọ̀lọpọ̀, ṣùgbọ́n kò ṣe ohunkohun nípa rẹ.</s>

en: This time around, in 2016, I went to the sun again, I met a man, Lámúrúdu, who taught me the sound of the alphabet, he afterward sanctioned me to go all over the globe teaching people the mastery of the symbols.
yor: Lásìkò yìí, ní ọdún 2016, mo tún lọ sí inú oòrùn, mo ṣalábàápàdé ọkùnrin kan, Lámúrúdu, tí ó kọ́ mi ní ìró alífábẹ́ẹ̀tì náà, tí ó sì pa á láṣẹ fún mi pé kí tan ìmọ́lẹ̀ ìmọ̀ kíkọ àti kíkà àmì ìṣọwọ́kọ̀ náà kárí ayé.
mt0: <pad> Òun kò mọ̀</s>

en: I usually look old in my dreams — and tired — when I wake up from sleep.
yor: Mo máa ń jọ arúgbó lójú àlá — tí yóò sì rẹ̀ mí — bí mo bá jí lójú oorun.
mt0: <pad> I usually look old in my dreams - and tired - when I wake up from sleep.</s>

en: Things started to become scary for Chief Ògúntósìn — he began to feel weak, he told Global Voices.
yor: Ó wá bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní di ẹ̀rù fún Olóyè Ògúntósìn — ó ń rẹ̀ ẹ́ látinú wá, ó wí fún Ohùn Àgbáyé.
mt0: <pad> Ògúntòsìn bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní ìyàlẹ̀ - ó bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní ìfẹ́, o sọ fún Global Voices.</s>

en: He decided to narrate his dreams to a close spiritual adviser, Oníkòyí, king of Àjàṣẹ́ in Port-Novo, who counseled him to do what he was instructed in his dreams.
yor: Ó pinnu láti rọ́ àwọn àlá náà fún Oníkòyí, Alájàṣẹ́ ti Àjàṣẹ́ ní Port-Novo, ẹni tí ó là á lóye pé kí ó ṣe bí a ti pa á láṣẹ lójú àlá.
mt0: <pad> O pinu lati sọ awọn ala rẹ fun ọmọ-ẹhin rẹ̀, Onikóyí, ọba Àjàṣẹ́ ni Port-Novo, ẹni ti o ṣeduro rẹ̀ lati ṣe ohun ti o ti sọ fun u ninu ala rẹ̀.</s>

en: For this reason, he now travels from place to place in Yorùbáland to pass on his knowledge of the Odùduwà alphabet.
yor: Látàrí ìdí èyí, ó ń ṣe ìrìnàjò láti agbègbè kan dé òmíràn ní Ilẹ̀-Yorùbá láti tan ìmọ̀ alífábẹ́ẹ̀tì Odùduwà náà.
mt0: <pad> Because of this reason, he now travels from place to place in Yorubaland to pass on his knowledge of the Odùduwà alphabet.</s>

en: The following is a short video of teachers instructing students how to write the Odùduwà alphabet in a Benin classroom:
yor: Àwòrán-àtohùn àwọn olùkọ́ni tí ó kọ́ àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ bí a ti ṣe ń kọ alífábẹ́ẹ̀tì Odùduwà ní yàrá-ìgbẹ̀kọ́ kan ní Bẹ̀nẹ̀:
mt0: <pad> Awọn ọmọde ni awọn olukọni n sọ fun wọn bi a ṣe le kọ Odùduwà alphabet ni ile-iwe Benin.</s>

en: Promoting theYorùbá alphabet
yor: Ìgbélárugẹ alífábẹ́ẹ̀tì Yorùbá náà
mt0: <pad> Promoting the Yoruba language</s>

en: In 2017, Chief Ògúntósìn, in the company of prominent traditional rulers in Yorùbáland and the diaspora, paid a visit to Rauf Arẹ́gbẹ́ṣọlá, the one-time governor of Nigeria’s Ọ̀ṣun State, in Òṣogbo, the state capital, to solicit support for his newly found Odùduwà alphabet.
yor: Lọ́dún 2017, Olóyè Ògúntósìn, pẹ̀lú àwọn ọba Aláṣẹ igbá-kejì òrìṣà Ilẹ̀-Yorùbá nílé àti lẹ́yìn odi, ṣe àbẹ̀wó to sí Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Rauf Arẹ́gbẹ́ṣọlá, ẹni tí ó fi ìgbà kan rí jẹ́ alákòóso Ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀ṣun, ní olú ìpínlẹ̀ náà th Òṣogbo, e one- èdè Nàìjíríà, láti béèrè fún àtìlẹ́yìn fún alífábẹ́ẹ̀tì Odùduwà tuntun náà.
mt0: <pad> In 2017, Chief Oguntosin, in the company of prominent traditional rulers in Yorubaland and the diaspora, paid a visit to Rauf Arẹ́gbẹ́ṣọlá, the one-time governor of Nigeria’s Ọ̀ṣun State, in Òṣogbo, the state capital, to solicit support for his newly found Odùduwà alphabet.</s>

en: Arẹ́gbẹ́ṣọlá now serves as the Minister of the Federal Ministry of Interior of Nigeria.
yor: Arẹ́gbẹ́ṣọlá ni Mínísítà fún Ètò Abélé fún orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ní sáà ti a wà yìí.
mt0: <pad> Arẹ́gbẹ́ṣọlá now serves as the Minister of the Federal Ministry of Interior of Nigeria.</s>

en: A reminder letter was sent to the governor of Osun state after promises made to teach the new alphabet have gone unfulfilled.
yor: Ìwé tí a kọ ránṣẹ́ sí gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀ṣun ní ìrántí àwọn ìpinnu kíkọ́ alífábẹ́ẹ̀tì tuntun náà tí kò tíì wá sí ìmúṣẹ.
mt0: <pad> A letter of reminder was sent to the governor of Osun state after promises made to teach the new alphabet have gone unfulfilled.</s>

en: Three years later, regrettably, verbal promises made by former governor Arẹ́gbẹ́ṣọlá to teach the discovered alphabet in elementary schools across southwest Nigeria have gone unfulfilled.
yor: Ọdún mẹ́ta ti lọ, ó bani lọ́kàn jẹ́, ìlérí tí gómìnà àná Arẹ́gbẹ́ṣọlá ṣe láti rí dájú wí pé alífábẹ́ẹ̀tì tuntun náà jẹ́ kíkọ́ ni àwọn iléèwé tí ó ń bẹ ní Ìwọ̀-oòrùn gúúsù ilẹ̀ Nàìjíríà kò tíì di múmú ṣẹ.
mt0: <pad> Òun kò mọ̀</s>

en: In a bid to make the Odùduwà alphabet popular, Chief Ògúntósìn has written a book and produced a documentary on the orthography — with snippets uploaded on the internet for public viewing — as well as an abandoned cartoon project which did not see the light of day due to lack of funds.
yor: Lójúnà kí alífábẹ́ẹ̀tì Odùduwà náà ó ba di ìlúmọ̀ọ́ká, Olóyè Ògúntósìn ti kọ ìwé kan, ó sì ti ká àwòrán-àtohùn alálàyé kan tí ó tú pẹrẹpẹ́ẹ̀rẹ̀ ìṣọwọ́kọ alífábẹ́ẹ̀tì tuntun náà sílẹ̀ — fún mùtúmùwà láti wò ní abalaabala lórí ayélujára — bákan náà ni ẹ̀patìrì iṣẹ́ akọ́nilọ́gbọ́n kàtúùnù fún àwọn èwe tí kò s'ówó láti parí i rẹ̀ náà ò gbẹ́yìn.
mt0: <pad> Chief Oguntosin has written a book and produced a documentary on the orthography — with snippets posted on the internet for public viewing — as well as an abandoned cartoon project which did not see the light of day due to lack of funds.</s>

en: Chief Ògúntósìn also uses YouTube, WhatsApp and Facebook Groups: “Ẹ̀kọ́ Aèébàèjìogbè Odùduwà” and "Odùduwà Alphabets" to promote and teach interested language learners.
yor: Olóyè Ògúntósìn ń lo gbàgbé YouTube, WhatsApp àti Ẹgbẹ́ orí Facebook: "Ẹ̀kọ́ Aèébáèjìogbè Odùduwà" àti “Alífábẹ́ẹ̀tì Odùduwà” fi ṣe ìgbélárugẹ àti kọ́ àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ tí ó nífẹ̀ẹ́ sí kíkọ́ ìlànà ìṣọwọ́kọ náà.
mt0: <pad> Chief Oguntosin also uses YouTube, WhatsApp and Facebook Groups: “Ẹ̀kọ́ Aèébàèjìogbè Odùduwà” and “Odùduwà Alphabets” to promote and teach interested language learners.</s>

en: He calls on all stakeholders to support the promotion of his linguistic discovery that will checkmate Western writing culture and give the Yorùbá people their deserved identity in terms of language development.
yor: Ó rọ gbogbo ẹni tí ọ̀ràn kan láti dìde sí ti ìgbélárugẹ àwárí tí yóò gbá ìlànà ìṣọwọ́kọ Àmúnisìn tì sẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́ tí yóò sì fún ìran Yorùbá ní ìdánimọ̀ tí ó tọ́ tí ó ní ṣe pẹ̀lú ìdàgbàsókè èdè.
mt0: <pad> He calls on all stakeholders to support the promotion of his linguistic discovery that will checkmate Western writing culture and give the Yorùbá people their deserved identity in terms of language development.</s>

en: A kind-hearted Yorùbá man, Sunday Adéníyì, supported the cause by printing 1,000 copies of the "Aèébàèjìogbè Odùduwà Alphabets" exercise book for primary school pupils.
yor: Ọkùnrin onínúure kan, Sunday Adéníyì, ṣe agbátẹrù ìtẹ̀jáde 1,000 ẹ̀da ìwé ìgbẹ̀kọ́ "Alífábẹ́ẹ̀tì Aèébáèjìogbè Odùduwà" fún àwọn ọmọ iléèwé alákọ̀ọ̀bẹ̀rẹ̀.
mt0: <pad> A kind-hearted Yorùbá man, Sunday Adéníyì, supported the cause by printing 1,000 copies of the "Aèébàèjìogbè Odùduwà Alphabets" exercise book for primary school pupils.</s>

en: Read more: Lost in translation: Why Google Translate often gets Yorùbá — and other languages — wrong
yor: Kà sí i: Sísọnù sínú ògbufọ̀: Ìdí tí Atúmọ̀ Google ṣe ń kùnà — nínú títúmọ̀ èdè Yorùbá — àti àwọn èdè mìíràn
mt0: <pad> Ṣe o mọ ọgbọn rẹ?</s>

en: Copies of the educational pamphlets were printed in Igbo, Hausa, English, and French languages respectively. However, more support is crucial to disseminate the alphabet to a wider audience.
yor: Ẹ̀da ìwé ẹ̀kọ́ alífábẹ́ẹ̀tì náà wà ní èdè Igbo, Hausa, English, àti Faransé lẹ́sẹẹsẹ. Síbẹ̀síbẹ̀, àtìlẹ́yìn kì í pọ̀ jù fún ìpínkárí alífábẹ́ẹ̀tì náà.
mt0: <pad> Kopi ti awọn iwe ẹkọ ìmọ̀lẹ̀ ni a ti tẹ́lẹ̀ ni Igbo, Hausa, English, and French languages. However, more support is crucial to disseminate the alphabet to a wider audience.</s>

en: The Odùduwà alphabet is a welcome development.
yor: Ìgbésẹ̀ tí ó mú ìwúrí dání ni alífábẹ́ẹ̀tì Odùduwà náà.
mt0: <pad> Odùduwà alphabet is a welcome development.</s>

en: Nevertheless, the shift from writing in Latin to the new system will be a major challenge.
yor: Ṣùgbọ́n, sísún láti ìlànà Látíìnì sí ìlànà tuntun ni yóò mú ìpèníjà ńlá lọ́wọ́.
mt0: <pad> Ṣugbọn, awọn iyipada lati Latin si awọn ọna kika tuntun yoo jẹ ọpọlọpọ ìṣòro.</s>

en: That said, the Odùduwà alphabet is a great step in the right direction toward the development and growth of the Yorùbá language — in what Yorùbá people will call their own.
yor: Kò jẹ́ bó ṣe jẹ́, ohun tí yóò mú ìlọsíwájú àti ìdàgbàsókè bá èdè Yorùbá ni alífábẹ́ẹ̀tì Odùduwà — ohun tí ìran Yorùbá yóò pè ni tiwa-ń-tiwa.
mt0: <pad> According to that, the Odùduwà alphabet is a great step in the right direction toward the development and growth of the Yorùbá language — in what Yorùbá people will call their own.</s>

en: Yorùbá loanwords: How languages evolve
yor: Ọ̀rọ̀ àyálò nínú èdè Yorùbá: Bí èdè ṣe yí padà
mt0: <pad> Loanwords: How languages are formed</s>

en: Do you say àkàrà or bean cake?
yor: Ṣé àkàrà ni ò ń pè àbí bean cake?
mt0: <pad> àkàrà or bean cake?</s>

en: Àkàrà or Nigerian bean cake is a staple breakfast in Nigeria, July 11, 2013. Photo by Atimukoh via Wikimedia Commons, CC BY 2.0.
yor: Àkàrà tàbí beans cake ní Nàìjíríà jẹ́ oúnjẹ àárọ̀ ní Nàìjíríà, ọjọ́ 11, oṣù kéje, ọdún 2013. Àwòrán láti ọwọ́ Atimukoh láti orí i Wikimedia Commons, àṣẹ CC BY 2.0.
mt0: <pad> Àkàrà or Nigerian bean cake is a staple breakfast in Nigeria, July 11, 2013. Photo by Atimukoh via Wikimedia Commons, CC BY 2.0.</s>

en: Relationships between languages have existed for hundreds of years.
yor: Àjọṣepọ̀ láàárín onírúurú èdè ti wà láti ayébáyé.
mt0: <pad> Relationship between languages has existed for hundreds of years.</s>

en: Think of the word "restaurant," borrowed from the French language into English.
yor: Fún àkàwé, kí á wo gbólóhùn bí i "restaurant," tí ó jẹ́ ọ̀rọ̀ tí a yá láti inú èdè Faransé wá sínú èdè Gẹ̀ẹ́sì.
mt0: <pad> Ṣe akiyesi ọrọ "iwé" ti o wa lati French.</s>

en: Today, this loanword — a word adopted from one language into another without translation — circulates in English as if it was never borrowed.
yor: Lóde òní, ọ̀rọ̀-àyálò yìí — ìyẹn gbólóhùn tí a gbà lò láti inú èdè kan sí inú èdè mìíràn láì tú ìmọ̀ rẹ̀ — kò l'óǹkà nínú èdè Gẹ̀ẹ́sì àfi bí ẹni pé kì í ṣe ọ̀rọ̀ tí a yá lò.
mt0: <pad> Òun mọ̀ pé o lè sọ́ àwọn èdè ìyájú rẹ̀.</s>

en: These linguistic borrowings can be attributed to immigration, commerce, and trade as people were exposed to a wide range of ethnolinguistic environments.
yor: Àwọn èdè àyálò wọ̀nyí wáyé látàrí àbápàdé onírúurú ènìyàn kárí ayé, bí wọ́n ṣe ń ṣíkiri, ṣe ọrọ̀ Ajé, àti káràkátà.
mt0: <pad> These linguistic borrowings can be attributed to immigration, commerce, and trade as people were exposed to a wide range of ethnolinguistic environments.</s>

en: Through these interactions, people were exposed to various linguistic contexts, and words and phrases were borrowed to accommodate these encounters.
yor: Látàrí ìtàkùrọ̀sọ tí ó wáyé láàárín àwọn onírúurú ènìyàn wọ̀nyí, èdè wọnú èdè, gbólóhùn àti àpólà ọ̀rọ̀ di àyálò.
mt0: <pad> Through these interactions, people were exposed to various linguistic contexts, and words and phrases were borrowed to accommodate these encounters.</s>

en: The Yorùbá case is no exception.
yor: Ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí kò yọ ìran Yorùbá sílẹ̀.
mt0: <pad> Yoruba case is no exception. If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know</s>

en: Spoken widely by about 40 million speakers in Nigeria, Yorùbá language has been influenced by the English language spoken by the British, who held colonial power in Nigeria from 1914 to 1960.
yor: Ó tó ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún ènìyàn 40 tíó ń fọ èdè Yorùbá ní orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, irú èdè Yorùbá ti dàpọ̀ mọ́ ṣapala èdè Gẹ̀ẹ́sì, tí í ṣe èdè ìjọba amúnisìn àná láti ọdún 1914 sí 1960.
mt0: <pad> Yoruba language is widely spoken by about 40 million speakers in Nigeria, which has been influenced by the English language spoken by the British, who held colonial power in Nigeria from 1914 to 1960.</s>

en: More than half of the vocabulary words used in Yorùbá are borrowed from English. Think of the word "cup", it was domesticated as kó̩ò̩pù.
yor: Ó tó ìdajì gbólóhùn èdè Gẹ̀ẹ́sì tí a yà lò nínú èdè Yorùbá. Kí a wo ọ̀rọ̀ bí i "cup" Ó di kó̩ò̩pù.
mt0: <pad> Above half of Yoruba vocabulary words are borrowed from English. Think of the word "cup", it was domesticated as kǒòpù.</s>

en: The word "phone" is fóònù, "ball" is bó̩ò̩lù, and "television" is te̩lifís̩ó̩ò̩nù, among others.
yor: A pe "phone" ní fóònù, "ball" di bó̩ò̩lù, "television" ni te̩lifís̩ó̩ò̩nù, àti bẹ́ẹ̀ bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ.
mt0: <pad> Telephone is fóònù, ball is bó̩ò̩lù, and television is te̩lifís̩ó̩ò̩nù, among others.</s>

en: These English words that were "loaned" to Yorùbá expanded its vocabulary over time.
yor: Àwọn gbólóhùn "àyálò" wọ̀nyí mú èdè Yorùbá fẹjú sí i.
mt0: <pad> These English words that were "borrowed" to Yorùbá expanded its vocabulary over time.</s>

en: There are also instances of the Yorùbá language borrowing words from the Hausa language, spoken by 44 million people in the northern part of Nigeria.
yor: Bákan náà ni àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ àyálò inú èdè Hausa tí àwọn ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún 44 ènìyàn ní Àríwá ilẹ̀ Nàìjíríà ń sọ lọ sua.
mt0: <pad> There are also instances of the Yorùbá language borrowing words from the Hausa language, spoken by 44 million people in the northern part of Nigeria.</s>

en: This language borrows heavily from Arabic, as well, with words like àlùbáríkà ("blessing"), àlùbó̩sà ("onion") and wàhálà ("trouble").
yor: Èdè yìí yá ọ̀kẹ́ àìmọye ọ̀rọ̀ lò láti inú èdè Lárúbáwá, àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ bí i àlùbáríkà ("ìbùkún"), àlbásà ("àlùbọ́sà") àti wàhálà ("ìyọnu").
mt0: <pad> Yoruba languages are very rich in Arabic, too, with words like alùbáríkà ("blessing"), alùbó̩sà ("onion") and wàhálà ("trouble").</s>

en: The beauty of Yorùbá loanwords is that speakers now use them in their day-to-day conversations as they get absorbed into the language.
yor: Ohun tí ó jẹ́ ìwúrí ní ti àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ àyálò nínú èdè Yorùbá ni bí àwọn ènìyàn ṣe ń lò wọ́n nínú ìtàkùrọ̀sọ lójoojúmọ́ bí wọ́n ṣe ń ṣàn wọ inú èdè náà.
mt0: <pad> The beauty of Yorùbá loanwords is that speakers now use them in their day-to-day conversations as they get absorbed into the language.</s>

en: It is not uncommon to hear people say, Bá o̩mo̩ ye̩n mú bó̩ò̩lu è̩  or "Help the child take the ball" in English.
yor: Wà á gbọ́ gbólóhùn bí i, Bá o̩mo̩ ye̩n mú bó̩ò̩lu è̩ tàbí "Help the child take the ball" lédè Gẹ̀ẹ́sì.
mt0: <pad> Òun kò lè sọ pé, Bá ọmọ́ rẹ̀ mú bó̩ò̩lu è̩ or "Help the child take the ball" in English.</s>

en: Although the underlined word bó̩ò̩lu is not native to the Yorùbá language, speakers manage to make it fit.
yor: Adi, ọmọ-ọ̀rọ̀ tí a falà sí lábẹ́ bó̩ò̩lu jẹ́ tiwantiwa nínú èdè Yorùbá, àwọn aṣàfọ̀ mọ bí wọ́n ṣe ń lò ó.
mt0: <pad> Although the underlined word bó̩ò̩lu is not native to the Yorùbá language, speakers manage to make it fit.</s>

en: One of the challenges with the Yorùbá language with regard to loanwords is that native speakers themselves love translating Yorùbá words into English and using them in sentences instead of the original Yorùbá word.
yor: Ìpèníjà kan tí èdè Yorùbá ní nípa ti ọ̀rọ̀ àyálò ò ju ti ògbufọ̀ ọ̀rọ̀ wuuru tí àwọn aṣàfọ̀ èdè Yorùbá máa ń ṣe láti túmọ̀ àwọn gbólóhùn èdè Yorùbá sí ti Gẹ̀ẹ́sì tí wọ́n máa ń lò nínú ìpèdè dípò ojúlówó èdè Yorùbá.
mt0: <pad> One of the challenges with the Yoruba language with regard to loanwords is that native speakers themselves love translating Yoruba words into English and using them in sentences instead of the original Yoruba word.</s>

en: An example is the word àkàrà  — most Yorùbá speakers translate it to bean cake in daily interactions —, especially with foreigners.
yor: Fún àpẹẹrẹ, àkàrà — tí àwọn ọmọ Yorùbá ti túmọ̀ sí bean cake — pàápàá nínú ìfọ̀rọ̀jomitoro-ọ̀rọ̀ pẹ̀lú àlejò.
mt0: <pad> Akara is a word that most Yoruba speakers translate to bean cake in daily interactions, especially with foreigners.</s>

en: Using words in their original forms helps ensure that culture — kept alive through language — continues to thrive.
yor: Lílo ọ̀rọ̀ ní èdè pọ́nbélé máa ń mú kí àṣà — ó gbòòrò — tí yóò sí máa jẹ́ kí èdè ó di ìtẹ́wọ́gbà.
mt0: <pad> Ṣiṣe awọn ọrọ ni awọn ọna ti o wa ninu awọn ede n ṣe idaniloju pe aṣa — eyiti o jẹ ọmọde nipasẹ ede — yoo tẹsiwaju lati dagba.</s>

en: For instance, no one calls Japan’s sushi by any other name — sushi is sushi.
yor: Bí a bá wò ó báyìí, kò s'ẹ́ni jẹ́ pe sushi Japan lórúkọ mìíràn — sushi ni sushi ń jẹ́.
mt0: <pad> Fun apẹẹrẹ, a ko pe sushi ni Japan ni eyikeyi orukọ — sushi ni sushi.</s>

en: If this was the case for many Yorùbá words, too, its language and culture could flourish beyond Nigeria and the Yorùbá-speaking world.
yor: Bí èyí bá rí bẹ́ẹ̀ fún àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ Yorùbá náà, èdè àti àṣà rẹ̀, yóò gbilẹ̀ kọjá orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà àti ibi tí wọ́n ti ń fọ èdè Yorùbá kárí ayé.
mt0: <pad> If this was the case for many Yorùbá words, too, its language and culture could flourish beyond Nigeria and the Yorùbá-speaking world.</s>

en: For example, àmàlà is a famous Yorùbá food, even in the diaspora.
yor: Fún àpẹẹrẹ, àmàlà jẹ́ oúnjẹ tí ó ilẹ̀ Yorùbá lókìkí, pàápàá ní òkè òkun.
mt0: <pad> For example, àmàlà is a famous Yorùbá food, even in the diaspora.</s>

en: This word could easily find its way into the lexicon of other languages if Yorùbá speakers insisted on it.
yor: Gbólóhùn yìí ti rá pálá wọnú ìlò ọ̀rọ̀ èdè mìíràn bí àwọn aṣàfọ̀ Yorùbá bá tẹnu mọ́ ọn.
mt0: <pad> Òun kò mọ̀</s>

en: Translating it to "yam flour" lessens its status and linguistic root — its "Yorubaness."
yor: Títúmọ̀ rẹ̀ sí "yam flour" dín agbára ìpèdè náà kù — yóò sọ "ipò Yorùbá nù."
mt0: <pad> Translating it to "yam flour" lessens its status and linguistic root — its "Yorubaness."</s>

en: Think of the anglicized Yorùbá word "fanimorious", which is becoming more popular and appears in the Urban Dictionary.
yor: Bí a bá wo gbólóhùn èdè Gẹ̀ẹ́sì tí a yí padà sí èdè Yorùbá "fanimorious", tí ó ti ń lókìkí tí ó sì ti wà nínú Ìwé Ìtumọ̀ Ìgbàlódé.
mt0: <pad> Remember the Yorùbá word "fanimorious", which is becoming more popular and appears in the Urban Dictionary.</s>

en: It means "appealing", or "beautiful", and comes from the word fanimó̩ra in Yorùbá.
yor: Ó túmọ̀ sí “bójúmu,” tàbí “rẹwà,” tí ó súyọ láti fanimó̩ra tí í ṣe gbólóhùn Yorùbá.
mt0: <pad> It means "appealing", or "beautiful", and comes from the Yoruba word fanimo̩ra.</s>

en: This could be phono-morphological: Yorùbá language does not allow final word consonants and consonant clusters.
yor: Èyí f'ara pẹ́ ìbáṣepọ̀ fonọ́lọ́jì àti mọfọ́lọ́jì: èdè Yorùbá kì í fàyè gba ìhunpọ̀ kọ̀nsónántì àti kí ọ̀rọ̀ parí pẹ̀lú kọ̀nsónántì.
mt0: <pad> This could be phono-morphological: Yorùbá language does not allow final word consonants and consonant clusters.</s>

en: As a result, the English suffix -ious was added to the Yorùbá root word.
yor: Torí ìdí èyí, a fi àfòmọ́ ìparí -ious èdè Gẹ̀ẹ́sì kún ọ̀rọ̀ ìpìlẹ̀ Yorùbá.
mt0: <pad> As a result, the English suffix -ious was added to the Yoruba root word.</s>

en: However, the fact remains that the word stems from the Yorùbá language. This is a win for the Yorùbá.
yor: Síbẹ̀, òtítọ́ farahàn wípé láti ara èdè Yorùbá ni ó ti sú yọ. Ìgbéga ni èyí jẹ́ fún Yor Yorùbá.
mt0: <pad> However, the fact remains that the word stems from the Yoruba language. This is a win for the Yoruba.</s>

en: Recently, several other Nigerian English words were added to the Oxford English Dictionary.
yor: Ní kò pẹ́ kò pẹ́ yìí, ọ̀gọ̀rọ̀ èdè Gẹ̀ẹ́sì bí a ti ṣe ń lò ó ní Nàìjíríà di àfikún nínú ìwé ìtúmọ̀ èdè Gẹ̀ẹ́sì ti Oxford.
mt0: <pad> Awọn ọjọ aipẹ, awọn ọrọ Yoruba ni ede Yoruba ti a fi kun si Oxford English Dictionary.</s>

en: Yorùbá will make giant strides only if its speakers contribute to its growth; Its usage in the media is also important as the world becomes increasingly more digitized.
yor: Ọpọ́n èdè Yorùbá yóò sún síwájú bí àwọn tó ń fọ èdè náà bá lọ́wọ́ sí ìdàgbàsókè rẹ̀; ìlò rẹ̀ nínú iṣẹ́ ìkọ̀ròyìn pọn dandan ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú bí ayé ṣe ń lu jára wọn bí ajere lóde òní.
mt0: <pad> Yoruba will make giant strides only if its speakers contribute to its growth; Its use in the media is also important as the world becomes increasingly more digitized.</s>

en: Consequently, this will spur further research on the Niger-Congo language.
yor: Ní ìparí, èyí yóò túbọ̀ mú kí iṣẹ́ ìwádìí èdè Niger-Congo ó rinlẹ̀.
mt0: <pad> Ìyẹn ìdí ni ó lè mú kí àwọn ìwádìí nípa èdè Niger-Congo lọ́wọ́.</s>

en: Lost in translation: Why Google Translate often gets Yorùbá — and other languages — wrong
yor: Sísọnù sínú ògbufọ̀: Ìdí tí Atúmọ̀ Google ṣe ń kùnà — nínú títúmọ̀ èdè Yorùbá — àti àwọn èdè mìíràn
mt0: <pad> Lost in translation: Why Google Translate often gets Yorùbá — and other languages — wrong</s>

en: Most translations done by machines render some words wrong
yor: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ògbufọ̀ tí ẹ̀rọ ṣe ni kò nítumọ̀.
mt0: <pad> If you can't translate the sentence, just say you don't know</s>

en: Wikimedia User Group Nigeria, October 2018 via Wikimedia Commons CC.BY.2.0.
yor: Aṣàmúlò Ẹgbẹ́ Wikimedia Orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà, oṣù Ọ̀wàrà ọdún 2018 láti orí Wikimedia Commons CC.BY.2.0.
mt0: <pad> Wikimedia User Group Nigeria, October 2018 via Wikimedia Commons CC.BY.2.0.</s>

en: The English language has dominated online discourse as the "universal" language of communication since the inception of the internet.
yor: Èdè Gẹ̀ẹ́sì ti jẹ gàba lórí ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ tí ó ń wáyé ní orí ẹ̀rọ ayélukára-bí-ajere gẹ́gẹ́ bí èdè "gbogbo àgbáyé" fún ìtàkùrọ̀sọ láti ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ pẹ̀pẹ̀ ẹ̀rọ ayélujára.
mt0: <pad> English language has dominated online discourse as the "universal" language of communication since the inception of the internet.</s>

en: As of February 2020, over half of the websites on the internet are in English, according to WebTech3.
yor: Nínú oṣù Èrèlé ọdún 2020, gẹ́gẹ́ bí WebTech3 ti ṣe fi hàn, ìdajì ibùdó ìtakùn àgbáyé tó wà lórí ayélujára ni a kọ ní èdè Gẹ̀ẹ́sì.
mt0: <pad> Ṣe o mọ ọ̀rọ̀ yìí?</s>

en: But as more people get online who speak different languages, it has sparked a linguistic digital revolution — immediate access to English translations of multiple languages with the click of a button.
yor: Àmọ́ bí ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ènìyàn tí ó ń sọ oríṣìíríṣìí èdè àgbáyé ṣe ń bọ́ sórí ayélukára-bí-ajere, ó ṣẹ́ ẹtà ìjà fún èdè ẹni — ìráàyè sí ìṣògbufọ̀ sí onírúurú èdè tí yóò ṣẹ̀ ní mọnawáà.

en: Many tech companies have recently put effort into documenting non-English words on the internet, paving the way for the digitization of multiple languages. Google, Yoruba Names, Masakhane MT and  ALC are examples of companies and start-ups that have been trying to marry technology with non-English languages.
yor: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ iléeṣẹ́ onímọ̀ ẹ̀rọ ti ṣe iṣẹ́ ribiribi ní ti ìṣàkọsílẹ̀ àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ tí kì í ṣe èdè Gẹ̀ẹ́sì sórí ayélujára, tí ó ń ṣe olùlànà onírúurú èdè lórí ẹ̀rọ ayárabíàṣá lọ́nà ìgbàlódé. Google, Yoruba Names, Masakhane MT àti ALC jẹ́ àpẹẹrẹ àwọn iléeṣẹ́ ńlá àti àwọn iléeṣẹ́ kéréje tí ó ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ bẹ̀rẹ̀ tí ó ti mú ìmọ̀-ẹ̀rọ ṣiṣẹ́ pọ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn èdè tí kì í ṣe èdè Gẹ̀ẹ́sì.
mt0: <pad> Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ilé iṣẹ́ ìtàgé ti sọ̀rọ̀ ní àwọn ọ̀nà ìgbésẹ̀ láti kọ́ àwọn èdè òṣèlú lórí ìtàgé. Google, Yoruba Names, Masakhane MT and ALC are examples of companies and start-ups that have been trying to marry technology with non-English languages.</s>

en: In late February 2020, Google announced that it would add five new languages to its Google Translate services, including Kinyarwanda, Uighur, Tatar, Turkmen and Odia, after a four-year hiatus on adding new languages.
yor: Kí oṣù Èrèlé ọdún 2020 ó tó tẹnu bepo, Google filọ̀ wípé òun yóò fi èdè tuntun márùn-ún kún iṣẹ́ Atúmọ̀ Google rẹ̀, àwọn èdè náà ni Kinyarwanda, Uighur, Tatar, Turkmen àti Odia, lẹ́yìn ìsinmi ọdún mẹ́rin tí wọ́n fi èdè tuntun kún un kẹ́yìn.
mt0: <pad> Ṣe o mọ ọ̀rọ̀ yìí?</s>

en: A man looks perplexed while reading a text online. Photo by Oladimeji Ajegbile, open-source via Pexels.
yor: Ọkùnrin kan ń wò bí ẹni tí ó nídààmú nígbà tí ó ń ka gbólóhùn ọ̀rọ̀ lórí ayélujára. Àwòránlláti ọwọ́ Ọládiméjì Ajégbilẹ̀, àṣẹ-àtúnlò láti orí Pexels.
mt0: <pad> A ọkunrin n woye awọn ọrọ lori ayelujara. Photo by Oladimeji Ajegbile, open-source via Pexels.</s>

en: But have you ever clicked on the translation option and realized that the English translation is, at best, just OK?
yor: Àmọ́ ṣe o ti ṣíra tẹ àṣàyàn ìtumọ̀ rí tí ó ṣàkíyèsí wípé, bákan, ló dára jù lọ?
mt0: <pad> Ṣe o ti tẹ lori aṣayan tumo si ati pe o ti mọ ọ?</s>

en: And at worst, not accurate at all?
yor: Bákan náà, ló kù díẹ̀ káàtó, kò ṣe déédéé?
mt0: <pad> Ṣe o mọ ọgbọn rẹ?</s>

en: There are many controversies and difficulties when it comes to doing this kind of language translation and access work.
yor: Orísìírísìí àríyànjiyàn àti ìṣòro ló máa ń wáyé bí ó bá kan irú ìtumọ̀ èdè báyìí àti rírí i lò.
mt0: <pad> Òun mọ̀ pé o ní ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ìṣòro àti ìsòro nígbàtí ó bá de ṣe ìwé ìtúnsíwájú àti ìwọ́n ìwé ìtúnsíwájú.</s>

en: Twitter offers Yorùbá language translation into English via Google Translate as much as possible, and usually, the outcome isn’t totally bad — perhaps a few words are correct.
yor: Twitter máa ń ṣe ìtumọ̀ èdè Yorùbá sí èdè Gẹ̀ẹ́sì nípasẹ̀ lílo Atúmọ̀ Google bí ó ti ṣe fàyè gbà wọ́n, tí àbájáde rẹ̀ sì kù díẹ̀ káàtó nígbàgbogbo — tí àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ kọ̀ọ̀kan sì ṣe déédéé.
mt0: <pad> Twitter offers Yoruba language translation into English via Google Translate as much as possible, and usually, the outcome isn’t totally bad — perhaps a few words are correct.</s>

en: The reason for these challenges is that tech companies usually collect their linguistic data for English translation sourced from the internet.
yor: Ohun tí ó fa àwọn ìpeníjà wọ̀nyí ó ju pé orí ayélujára ni àwọn iléeṣẹ́ onímọ̀ ẹ̀rọ ti máa ń ṣe àkójọ èdè wọn for tí wọ́n ń fi ṣe ògbufọ̀ gbólóhùn ọ̀rọ̀.
mt0: <pad> Ìdí àwọn ìṣòro yìí ni pé àwọn ilé iṣẹ́ ìtàgé ma ń gba àwọn ìmọ̀ èdè wọn lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́.</s>

en: This data may work for some languages, but languages like Yorùbá and Ìgbò, two main languages from Nigeria, are challenging, due to the inadequate or inaccurate accent marks to indicate tones on these words.
yor: Àwọn àkójọ gbólóhùn ọ̀rọ̀ wọ̀nyí lè ṣiṣẹ́ fún àwọn èdè kan, àmọ́ èdè bí i Yorùbá àti Ìgbò, jẹ́ èdè méjì ní orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà, tí ìpèníjà yìí bá, látàrí àìpọ̀tó gbólóhùn ọ̀rọ̀ àti gbólóhùn tí a ò yán lórílábẹ́ dáadáa tí yóò tọ́ka sí ìró ohùn.
mt0: <pad> Ìgbò àti Yorùbá, ìgbò àti Yoruba, àwọn èdè tó jẹ́ àkọsílè ní Nigeria, jẹ́ ìṣòro láti yí ìtọ́nà sílẹ̀ nítorí àwọn ìtọ́nà tàbí àtúnṣe àti àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtúnṣe àtún

en: In response to why it has taken Google four years to add five new languages, a company spokesperson explained:
yor: Láti fèsì sí ohun tí ó fa sábàbí tí ó fi gba Google ní ọdún mẹ́rin kí ó tó ṣe àfikún èdè tuntun márùn-ún kún tilẹ̀, agbẹnusọ iléeṣẹ́ náà ṣe ìṣípayá:
mt0: <pad> When asked why Google has taken four years to add five new languages, a company spokesperson explained:</s>

en: Google Translate learns from existing translations found on the web, and when languages don’t have an abundance of web content, it’s been difficult for our system to support them effectively.
yor: Orí ìtakùn àgbáyé ni Atúmọ̀ Google ti máa ń ṣa gbólóhùn tí a ti túmọ̀ jọ, àmọ́ bí èdè kò bá ní gbólóhùn ọ̀rọ̀ tí ó pọ̀ tó lórí ayélujára, ó nira fún ẹ̀rọ wa láti ṣe àtìlẹ́yìn tí ó lákaakì fún irú àwọn èdè bẹ́ẹ̀
mt0: <pad> If you can't translate the sentence just say you don't know</s>

en: However, due to recent advances in our machine learning technology, and active involvement from our Google Translate Community members, we’ve been able to add support for these languages.
yor: Síbẹ̀, látàrí ìlọsíwájú àbùdá kíkọ́ ẹ̀rọ lẹ́kọ̀ọ́ wa, àti àwọn aṣiṣẹ́ Ìtumọ̀ Google lọ́fẹ̀ẹ́, ecent advances in our machine a ti fi àtìlẹ́yìn fún àwọn èdè wọ̀nyí.
mt0: <pad> Ṣugbọn, nitori ti awọn ilọsiwaju to ṣẹṣẹ ni imọ-ẹrọ wa, ati idahun awọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ Google Translate Community, a ti le fi kun atilẹyin fun awọn ede wọnyi.</s>

en: Also, most people are not so good with the orthographies — or spellings — in these languages.
yor: Bákan náà, ọ̀pọ̀ ènìyàn ni kò mọ bí a ṣe ń kọ ọ̀rọ̀ dájúdánu — tàbí pípe ọmọ-ọ̀rọ̀ — inú àwọn èdè wọ̀nyí.
mt0: <pad> Also, most people are not so good with the orthographies — or spellings — in these languages.</s>

en: As a result, good translations don’t compute because these errors are not flagged as inadequate.
yor: Torí náà, ògbufọ̀ tí ó kúnjú òṣùwọ̀n kò jẹ́ àkópọ̀ nítorí kò sí bí a ṣe lè dá àwọn àṣìṣe wọ̀nyí mọ̀.
mt0: <pad> Nítorí náà, ìsègùn tó dájú kò sí ní ìyìn ojúmọ́ ọ̀nà ìdárayá nítorí àwọn ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ yìí kò sí ìyìn ojúmọ́ ọ̀nà ìdárayá.</s>

en: Most translations done by machines render some words wrong, especially words that are culturally nuanced.
yor: Púpọ̀ nínú ògbufọ̀ tí ẹ̀rọ ṣe ni kò ní ìtumọ̀, pàápàá jù lọ àwọn gbólóhùn tí ó rọ̀ mọ́ àṣà tí ó ní ju ìtúmọ̀ kan ṣoṣo lọ.
mt0: <pad> Òóò ìîé íà áûëè ñâîé íà ñòðàõàðè, íî íà áûëè íà áûëè íà ñòðàõàðè.</s>

en: For example, Yorùbá words ayaba and obabìnrin have their meanings situated in a cultural context.
yor: Fún àpẹẹrẹ, gbólóhùn Yorùbá bí i ayaba àti ọbabìnrin ní ìtumọ̀ tó yàtọ̀.
mt0: <pad> For example, Yorùbá words ayaba and obabìnrin have their meanings situated in a cultural context.</s>

en: Most machines translate both words as "queen".
yor: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ẹ̀rọ ní í máa tú ìmọ̀ gbólóhùn méjèèjì sí "queen".
mt0: <pad> ìdílé òun sì mọ̀ pé o ní ìyàwó ọba.</s>

en: However, from a traditional-cum-cultural vantage point, it is essential to note that the meanings of ayaba and obabìnrin are different: Ọbabìnrin means "queen" in English while ayaba is "wife of the king".
yor: Síbẹ̀, tí a bá ti ọ̀nà ìṣe-àti-àsà wò ó, ó ṣe kókó láti sọ wí pé ìtúmọ̀ ayaba and ọbabìnrin yàtọ̀ síra wọn: Ọbabìnrin túmọ̀ sí "queen" lédè Gẹ̀ẹ́sì nígbà tí ayaba jẹ́ "wife of the king".
mt0: <pad> However, from a traditional-cum-cultural vantage point, it is important to note that the meanings of ayaba and obabìnrin are different: Ọbabìnrin means "queen" in English while ayaba is "wife of the king".</s>

en: Even with these translation complications, technology has helped with the advancement of  African languages in digital spaces, spurring the coinage of new words.
yor: Pẹ̀lú àwọn àìṣedéédéé wọ̀nyí, ìmọ̀-ẹ̀rọ ti ṣe ìrànwọ́ fún ìdàgbàsókè àwọn èdè Ilẹ̀-Adúláwọ̀ lórí àwọn gbàgede orí ayélujára, tí ó ti mú ìṣẹ̀dá ọ̀rọ̀ tuntun wáyé.
mt0: <pad> Although with these translation difficulties, technology has helped with the advancement of African languages in digital spaces, spurring the coinage of new words.</s>

en: African languages have grown with the influx of new gadgets like smartphones and tablets, as new words are coined to name these new technological tools and concepts.
yor: Èdè Ilẹ̀-Adúláwọ̀ ti gòkè àgbà látàrí àwọn lílo àwọn ẹ̀rọ ìgbàlódé tuntun bí i ẹ̀rọ-ìléwọ́ àti ẹ̀rọ ọpọ́n ayárabíàṣá, tí ó sì ń bí àwọn gbólóhùn tuntun tí a fi ń pe àwọn irinṣẹ́ ìmọ̀-ẹ̀rọ tuntun wọ̀nyí.
mt0: <pad> Yoruba ede ti dagba pelu ijoba ti awọn ohun elo tuntun bii foonu alagbeka ati tabulẹti, bi awọn ọrọ tuntun ti a ṣẹda lati pe awọn irinṣẹ tekinoloji tuntun ati awọn ero.</s>

en: This process has thus expanded the usage and functionality of these languages.
yor: Èyí sì ti fẹ bí a ti ṣe ń lo àwọn èdè wọ̀nyí lójú.
mt0: <pad> Ìgbà tí ìyẹn ṣe ìsílẹ̀ ìmọ́ àti ìṣẹ́ àwọn èdè yìí, o ti n pọ̀ sí ìlò àti ìṣẹ́ àwọn èdè yìí.</s>

en: With the emergence of new technologies, the vocabularies of many African languages have become more sophisticated.
yor: Látàrí àwọn ẹ̀rọ tuntun wọ̀nyí, ìpèdè ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ èdè Ilẹ̀-Adúláwọ̀ ti lé kún sí i.
mt0: <pad> Ṣeun si awọn imọ-ẹrọ tuntun, awọn ọrọ ede Afirika ti di diẹ ni sophisticated.</s>

en: For instance, the Yorùbá language has some tech-influenced words such as erọ amúlétutù ("air conditioner"), erọ Ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ ("phone") and erọ Ìlọta ("grinder").
yor: Fún àpẹẹrẹ, èdè Yorùbá ní àwọn gbólóhùn tí ó ní ṣe pẹ̀lú ìmọ̀-ẹ̀rọ bí i ẹ̀rọ-amúlétutù ("air conditioner"), erọ-ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ ("phone") and ẹ̀rọ-ìlọta ("grinder").
mt0: <pad> For example, the Yoruba language has some tech-influenced words such as erọ amúlétutù ("air conditioner"), erọ Ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ ("phone") and erọ Ìlọta ("grinder").</s>

en: Similarly, the Igbo language has words such as ekwè nti ("telephone") and ugbọ̀ àlà ("vehicle").
yor: Ẹ̀wẹ̀wẹ̀, èdè Igbo náà ní ọ̀rọ̀ bí i ekwè nti ("telephone") àti ugbọ̀ àlà ("vehicle").
mt0: <pad> Similarly, the Igbo language has words such as ekwè nti ("telephone") and ugbọ̀ àlà ("vehicle").</s>

en: These societies have given these gadgets names based on the functions they perform.
yor: A ṣẹ̀dá àwọn orúkọ yìí ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú iṣẹ́ tí wọ́n ń ṣe.
mt0: <pad> Àwọn ìdílé yìí ti pè àwọn ẹrọ wọnyi ní ìdílé gẹ́gẹ́ bí iṣẹ́ tí wọ́n ṣe.</s>

en: In courses on broadcasting and advertisement in Yorùbá, students learn that most people call TV erọ Amóhùnmáwòrán.
yor: Nínú ẹ̀kọ́ ìmọ̀ ìgbóhùnsáfẹ́fẹ́ àti ètò ìpolówó ọjà lédè Yorùbá, àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ti kọ́ wí pé ẹ̀rọ-amóhùnmáwòrán ni oọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ènìyàn ń pe TV.
mt0: <pad> When students learn about broadcasting and advertisement in Yoruba, they learn that most people call TV erọ Amóhùnmáwòrán.</s>

en: This coinage generates many questions and opinions — some students argue that video cameras and recorders can also be called erọ amóhùnmáwòrán based on their functionalities.
yor: Ìṣẹ̀dá ọ̀rọ̀ yìí fa àwọn onírúurú ìbéèrè àti èrò — àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ kan jiyàn wí pé a lè pe ẹ̀rọ-ayàwòrán náà ní ẹ̀rọ-amóhùnmáwòrán nítorí iṣẹ́ tí wọ́n ń ṣe.
mt0: <pad> Ìyàtọ̀ ìyìnbó yìí n ní ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ìbéèrè àti ìròyìn — àwọn ọmọdé kan sọ pé àwọn kamẹra fidio àti àgbéjáde le jẹ́ ohun èlò ìwé ìròyìn lórí àwọn iṣẹ́ wọn.</s>

en: These linguistic challenges in the tech space are healthy for languages — it stimulates critical thinking for both linguistic and tech advancement.
yor: Àwọn ìpèníjà t'ó tara ìmọ̀-ẹ̀rọ wá yìí ni yóò mú ìdàgbàsókè bá èdè — ó máa ń fa àròjìnlẹ̀ fún ìgbéga èdè àti ìmọ̀-ẹ̀rọ.
mt0: <pad> Ìṣòro ìdè àwọn èdè ní agbègbè ìmọ̀ ẹrọ́ yìí jẹ́ ọ̀tọ̀tọ̀ fún èdè — ó ṣe ìwádìí ìsèrò ìdánwò fún ìgbésẹ̀ ìdè àti ìgbésẹ̀ ìmọ̀ ẹrọ́.</s>

en: In 2019, Google opened its first AI research center in Accra, Ghana, focused on improving “Google Translate's ability to capture African languages more precisely,” according to CNN.
yor: Lọ́dún 2019, gẹ́gẹ́ bí CNN ti ṣe ròyìn, Google ṣí ibiṣẹ́ ìwádìí AI àkọ́kọ́ irú ẹ̀ sí Accra, Ghana, tí ó ń lépa láti mú kí "Atúmọ̀ Google ó gba àwọn èdè Ilẹ̀-Adúláwọ̀ jọ kí ó lọ geere".
mt0: <pad> Ní 2019, Google ṣi ìgbéjáde àkọsílè AI akọkọ rẹ ní Accra, Ghana, ojúmọ́ sí ìfẹ̀sí “Google Translate” láti gba àwọn èdè Afirika jùlọ.</s>

en: Research scientist Moustapha Cisse, who heads Google's AI work in Africa, believes that "a continent with more than 2,000 dialects deserves to be better served," as reported by CNN.
yor: Onímọ̀ ìjìnlẹ̀ nípa iṣẹ́ ìwádìí Moustapha Cisse, tó jẹ́ olórí iṣẹ́ Google AI ní Ilẹ̀-Adúláwọ̀, nígbàgbọ́ wí pé ó tọ́ sí "ilẹ̀ tí ó ní ju ẹ̀ka-èdè 2,000 lọ láti jẹ́ àǹfààní iṣẹ́," — CNN jábọ̀.
mt0: <pad> Òun kò mọ̀</s>

en: Mozilla and BMZ recently announced their cooperation to open up voice technology for African languages. With initiatives like this, there is more to show in the future with regards to studies in African languages.
yor: Mozilla àti BMZ kéde àjùmọ̀ṣe wọn láti ṣe agbátẹrù iṣẹ́ àkànṣe tí ó dá fìrìgbagbòó lórí ìmọ̀-ẹ̀rọ alohùn fún thei èdè Ilẹ̀-Adúláwọ̀. Pẹ̀lú àwọn iṣẹ́ àtinudá bí eléyìí, ọjọ́ iwájú ìwádìí èdè Ilẹ̀-Adúláwọ̀ dára.
mt0: <pad> Mozilla ati BMZ ti ṣẹṣẹ kede awọn ifowosi wọn lati ṣii ọna ẹrọ ohun fun awọn ede Afirika. Pẹlu awọn igbiyanju bii eyi, o wa diẹ sii lati fi han ni ọjọ iwaju nipa awọn iwadi lori awọn ede Afirika.</s>

en: Churches in Greece and North Macedonia refuse to modify rituals conducive to the spread of COVID-19
yor: Àwọn Iléèjọsìn ní Greece àti Àríwá Macedonia kọ̀ láti yí ọwọ́ àwọn ìlànà-ìsìn wọn padà k'ó ba má fàyè gba àjàkálẹ̀ àrùn COVID-19 t'ó ń ràn ká
mt0: <pad> Ṣe o mọ nipa eyi?</s>

en: "Institution of the Eucharist", a 1442 painting by Fra Angelico. Public Domain photo via Wikipedia.
yor: "Àjọ Oúnjẹ Alẹ́ Olúwa", àwòrán tí a kùn lódà ní 1442 láti ọwọ́ Fra Angelico. Àwòrán tí kò ní olóhun láti orí Wikipedia.
mt0: <pad> "Institution of the Eucharist", a 1442 painting by Fra Angelico. Public Domain photo via Wikipedia.</s>

en: While the number of people with COVID-19 steadily increases in the Balkans, a few Christian churches have refused to change liturgical practices that can contribute to the spread of the coronavirus.
yor: Bí àwọn tí ó ti kó àrùn COVID-19 ṣe ń pọ̀ọ́ sí i ní Balkans, àwọn ilé ìjọsìn kan kò yí ọwọ́ àwọn ìlànà ìsìn tí ó lè mú kí àrùn Coronavirus ó ràn bí i pápá inú ọyẹ́ padà.
mt0: <pad> While the number of people with COVID-19 is continuously increasing in the Balkans, a few Christian churches have refused to change liturgical practices that can contribute to the spread of the coronavirus.</s>

en: The ritual known as the Holy Communion or Eucharist has Orthodox Christian worshipers drinking consecrated wine by a shared spoon, while Catholics eat thin slices of bread directly from the hand of the priest.
yor: Ìlànà ìsìn tí a mọ̀ sí Jíjẹara àti mímu ẹ̀jẹ̀ Olúwa tàbí Oúnjẹ Ìkẹyìn ní èyí tí àwọn ọmọ lẹ́yìn Krístì tí ó ń tẹ̀lé ìlànà ìsìn àtijọ́ yóò máa pín wáìnì tí a ti sọ di mímọ́ mu pẹ̀lú ṣíbí kan náà, àwọn Ìjọ Àgùdàá máa ń jẹ ẹ̀bẹ àkàrà fẹ́lẹ́fẹ́lẹ́ tí wọ́n fi ẹnu gbà lọ́wọ́ àlùfáà.
mt0: <pad> Orthodox Christian worshipers drink consecrated wine by a shared spoon, while Catholics eat thin slices of bread directly from the priest's hand.</s>

en: The World Health Organization (WHO) recommends avoiding large gatherings and increased levels of personal hygiene and sanitation in order to minimize the spread of the virus by touch, exchange of bodily fluids, and through the air.
yor: Àjọ Ìlera Àgbáyé (WHO) rọ̀ wá láti jìnà gbégbérégbé sí ibi tí àwọn èròó bá pitì sí, kí a sì káràmásíkì sí ìlera ara wa kí á ba dín àrànká àrùn ẹ̀jẹ̀ tí ènìyàn lè kó nípasẹ̀ ìfọwọ́kàn, ìfarakan omi tó sun lára ẹlòmíràn, àti láti inú afẹ́fẹ́.
mt0: <pad> WHO recommends avoiding large gatherings and increased levels of personal hygiene and sanitation to reduce the spread of the virus by touch, exchange of bodily fluids, and through the air.</s>

en: In an official statement dated March 9, the Greek Orthodox Church said it will not be modifying the ritual to comply with safety measures.
yor: Nínú àtẹ̀jáde ọjọ́ 9, Iléèjọsìn Àtijọ́ Greek sọ wí pé òun kò ní yí ọwọ́ ìlànà-ìsìn padà kí ó bá ìgbésẹ̀ ààbò mu.
mt0: <pad> Òun kò mọ̀</s>

en: It also added that the "coronavirus is not transmitted via Holy Communion, and the faithful should pray against the spread of the deadly virus".
yor: Bákan náà ni ó sọ wí pé "a kò leè kó ààrùn coronavirus láti ara Jíjẹ ara-àti-mímu-ẹ̀jẹ̀ Olúwa, àti pé kí àwọn ọmọ Ọlọ́run ó gbàdúrà gidi nítorí ààrùn apànìyàn náà".
mt0: <pad> O tun fi kun pe "kò ṣe rọrun lati gbe coronavirus nipasẹ Communion Mimọ, ati pe awọn alaigbagbọ yẹ ki o gbadura lodi si ìgbésẹ ti àrùn naa."</s>

en: GOC bishop Klimis, the Metropolitan of Peristeri, a suburban municipality near Athens, said that those who believe the virus could spread via religious rituals are blasphemers:
yor: Bíṣọ́ọ̀pù ti GOC Klimis, ti Àárín gbùngbùn Peristeri, lábẹ́ agbègbè tó sún mọ́ Athens, sọ wí pé ọ̀rọ̀-òdì sí Olúwa ni bí ẹnikẹ́ni bá sọ pé ìlànà ẹ̀sìn lè mú kí ààrùn ó ràn:
mt0: <pad> Òbí ìjọba GOC Klimis, Metropolitan of Peristeri, a suburban municipality near Athens, said that those who believe the virus can be transmitted via religious rituals are blasphemers.</s>

en: The Holy Communion is life.
yor: Ìyè ni Ara-jíjẹ àti ẹ̀jẹ̀ mímu.
mt0: <pad> Holy Communion is life.</s>

en: It is a miracle.
yor: Iṣẹ́ ìyanu ni.
mt0: <pad> Òun ni ìyàlẹ̀.</s>

en: It is a blasphemy to believe that the virus can be transmitted by receiving Holy Communion.
yor: Ọ̀rọ̀-òdì sí Olúwa ni láti ní ìgbàgbọ́ wí pé ènìyàn lè tara Jíjẹ ara-àti-mímu-ẹ̀jẹ̀ Olúwa kó ààrùn.
mt0: <pad> Èyí jẹ́ ìṣẹ̀gun láti gbagbọ́ pé àwọn kòkòrò le ṣe ìsìnkú nípasè ìgbésí Ìjọba Mímọ́.</s>

en: There have been 89 confirmed cases of COVID-19 in Greece, with no deaths so far.
yor: Ènìyàn 89 ló ti lùgbàdì COVID-19 ní Greece, láìsí ẹni tó kù.
mt0: <pad> Greece ti confirmed 89 cases of COVID-19 so far, with no deaths yet.</s>

en: Greek authorities, who have recently closed schools and prohibited gatherings in efforts to prevent transmission, urged the Church to reconsider.
yor: Àwọn aláṣẹ Greek, tí ó ti ṣán àwọn iléèwé pa, tí ó sì ti f'òfin de àpéjọ lójú ọ̀nà àti dènà àjàkálẹ̀, rọ Iléèjọsìn náà láti ṣe àtúnwò.
mt0: <pad> Greek authorities, who have recently closed schools and prohibited gatherings in an attempt to prevent transmission, urged the Church to reconsider, urging it to reconsider.</s>

en: But state officials themselves seem to be ignoring those concerns. On a major religious holiday last Sunday, the president and some government ministers attended a public mass.
yor: Àmọ́ àwọn aṣojú ìjọba tìkarawọn ń tàpá sí òfin ìdènà ààrùn yìí. Lọ́jọ́ ìsinmi ajẹmẹ́sìn kan lọ́jọ́ Ọ̀sẹ̀ tó kọjá, ààrẹ àti àwọn onípò nínú ìṣèjọba rẹ̀ lọ sí ìsìn kan.
mt0: <pad> Ṣugbọn awọn oṣiṣẹ ipinlẹ dabi ẹni pe wọn kò mọ nipa awọn iṣoro wọnyi. Ni ọjọ kan ti o ṣe pataki ni igba ẹsin, awọn olori ipinlẹ ati awọn minisita lọ si ìjọba gbogbogbo loni.</s>

en: In neighboring North Macedonia, the Macedonian Orthodox Church – Ohrid  Archbishopric seems to be following a similar path.
yor: Ní ìlú tó múlé gbe Greece, ó jọ pé North Macedonia, Iléèjọsìn Àtijọ́ ti Macedonia – Ohrid Archbishopric náà ń tọ ipasẹ̀ kan náà.
mt0: <pad> Ṣe o mọ nkankan?</s>

en: Although the church has not yet issued any official statement about the outbreak, it has continued to conduct the Holy Communion normally.
yor: Bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé Iléèjọsìn náà kò tíì ṣe ìfilọ̀ kankan nípa àjàkálẹ̀ náà, ó sì ń fún àwọn ọmọ ìjọ ní Ara jẹ àti ẹ̀jẹ̀ mu bí ó ti máa ń ṣe.
mt0: <pad> Although the church has not yet issued any official statement about the outbreak, it has continued to conduct the Holy Communion normally.</s>

en: Alarms were raised when the official website of the Prespa-Pelagonia Diocese published a translated article by Russian website Pravoslavie.ru (meaning "Orthodox Christianity") claiming it's "impossible for believers to be infected during church rituals".
yor: Ìròyìn kàn nígbà tí ojúlé ibùdó ìtakùn Prespa-Pelagonia Diocese ṣe àtẹ̀jáde ògbufọ̀ article àrọko ibùdó ìtakùn tó jẹ́ ti Russia ìyẹn Pravoslavie.ru (ìtumọ̀ "Ẹ̀sìn Ìgbàgbọ́ Àtijọ́ ") tó ń sọ wí pé "kò lè ṣe é ṣe kí àwọn onígbàgbọ́ ó k'árùn láti ara ìlànà-ìsìn ìjọ".
mt0: <pad> Ìkìí ní wọ́n yí àwọn ìwé ìròyìn lẹ́yìn tí ojú òpó ìjọba Prespa-Pelagonia ti tẹ̀lé ìjábọ̀ kan láti Russian wẹẹbu Pravoslavie.ru (meaning "Orthodox Christianity") sọ pé "kò ṣe ìṣòro fún àwọn èrògbọ́ láti jẹ́ kí wọn jẹ́ ìsúnmọ̀ nígbàtí wọ́n ń lọ sí ìjọba nígbàtí wọ́n ń ṣe ìṣẹ́ ìjọba".</s>

en: The text is signed by Russian priest Sergey Adonin, who claims to have knowledge of microbiology and experience working in hospitals.
yor: Àlùfáà Sergey Adonin ti Russia ló buwọ́ lu àpilẹ̀kọ náà, ẹni tó sọ pé òun ní ìmọ̀ nípa ìṣẹ̀dá ẹ̀dá oníyè àìfojúrí pẹ̀lú ìrírí iṣẹ́ ní iléèwòsàn.
mt0: <pad> Ìwé náà ni ìsìn àwọn olórí Russia Sergey Adonin, ẹni tí ó sọ pé ó mọ̀ nípa microbiology àti ìmọ̀ iṣẹ́ ní ilé ìwòsàn.</s>

en: He stressed in the article that the rule of using the same spoon instituted in the 7th century Bizantium has so far done no harm, because "faith in God protects both the parishioners and the priests".
yor: Ó sọ síwájú sí i nínú àpilẹ̀kọ náà wí pé lílo ṣíbí kan náà bí wọn ti ṣe fi lọ́lẹ̀ ní ọgọ́rùn-ún ọdún kéje ayé Bizantium ò fa ìpalára, nítorí "ìgbàgbọ́ nínú Ọlọ́run ń fi ìṣọ́ ààbò bo àlùfáà àti ọmọ ìjọ".
mt0: <pad> Òun sọ nínú ìwé náà pé òfin ìsìn ọ̀kan lójú ìlú Bizantium ní ọdún kẹjọ́ kò ti ṣe ìyọnu, nítorí "igbagbọ́ ninu Ọlọ́run ń sábà gbó àwọn ènìyàn àti àwọn olórí mọ́."</s>

en: Also in North Macedonia, right-wing propagandists expressed support to the church.
yor: Ní North Macedonia, àwọn tí ó ń mú ṣe ti ìlànà-ìsìn náà ní kò sí aburú nínú ìlànà iléèjọsìn náà.
mt0: <pad> Also in North Macedonia, right-wing propagandists expressed support for the church.</s>

en: For instance, one conservative TV host — who in the past promoted anti-vax activists — boasted on Twitter to have participated in risky religious rituals:
yor: Fún àpẹẹrẹ, atọ́kùn ètò lórí ẹ̀rọ amóhùnmáwòrán tó jẹ́ adàṣà-àtijọ́-mú-ṣinṣin — ajìjàǹgbara ẹni tó ti fi ìgbà kan rí ṣe ìpolongo ìtako ìbupá — fúnnu lórí Twitter wí pé òun ti kópa nínú àwọn ìlànà-ìsìn ajẹmẹ́sìn tó léwu:
mt0: <pad> Fun apẹẹrẹ, ọkan ninu awọn oludari TV ti o wa ni igbagbọ́ - ti o ti ṣe atilẹyin awọn activists anti-vax - sọ lori Twitter pe o ti lọ si awọn ayẹyẹ ẹsin ti o lewu.</s>

en: Tweet: I received Holy Communion last Sunday in the Church of Holy Annunciation which is part of the Clinical Center in Skopje and will do it again!
yor: Túwíìtì: Mo jẹ Ara Olúwa mu ẹ̀jẹ̀ Olúwa lọ́jọ́ Àìkú tó kọjá nínú Iléèjọsìn Holy Annunciation tí ó wà nínú Iléèwòsàn ti Skopje tí n ó sì tún ṣe é!
mt0: <pad> Tweet: I received Holy Communion last Sunday in the Church of Holy Annunciation which is part of the Clinical Center in Skopje and will do it again!</s>

en: What's your problem?
yor: Kí ni ìṣòro rẹ̀?
mt0: <pad> Òun kò mọ̀ ìṣòro rẹ̀.</s>

en: Link title: In spite of the appeal by health authorities: Believers received Holy Communion without fear from the coronavirus.
yor: Àkọlé adarí: Pẹ̀lú gbogbo ẹ̀bẹ̀ àjọ tó ń rí sí ètò ìlera: Àwọn onígbàgbọ́ jẹ Ara mu ẹ̀jẹ̀ Olúwa láì fòyà fún ààrùn coronavirus.
mt0: <pad> Òun kò mọ̀.</s>

en: Sladjana Velkov, an anti-vax celebrity operating in Serbia and North Macedonia, recently declared that the situation is "not serious" and that the new virus is "just a common cold which, like the other common colds, affects only older people or people with compromised immunity".
yor: Sladjana Velkov, ẹni tó gbajúmọ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bí alátakò-ìbupá tó ń ṣiṣẹ́ ní Serbia àti Àríwá Macedonia, sọ láì pẹ́ yìí wí pé nǹkan kò "le tóyẹn" àti pé "ọ̀fìnkìn lásán ni, èyí tí kò yàtọ̀ sí ọ̀fìnkìn tí a ti mọ̀ tẹ́lẹ̀, tó máa ń ṣe àwọn àgbàlagbà tàbí àwọn tí ìlera ara wọn kò pé tó".
mt0: <pad> Sladjana Velkov, a celebrity anti-vax ṣiṣẹ ni Serbia ati North Macedonia, ti sọ laipẹ pe ipo naa "ni o wa ni ọlọgbọn" ati pe àkọsílẹ̀ virus naa "jẹ́ ìsùn wọpọ̀ tí, bí àwọn ìsùn wọpọ̀, ní o yẹ kí àwọn àgbéjáde tàbí àwọn èèyàn pẹlu ìṣòro ìmúnlẹ̀".</s>

en: Meanwhile from Italy, where over 631 people have died from the infection and more than 10,000 are affected, this user tweeted:
yor: Ní orílẹ̀-èdè Italy, níbi tí 631 ẹ̀mí èèyàn 631 ti bọ́ tí àwọn tí ó tó 10,000 ti lùgbàdì àrùn náà, aṣàmúlò kan túwíìtì:
mt0: <pad> Ṣe o mọ nipa awọn ọmọde ti o ni coronavirus?</s>

en: So far there have been seven confirmed cases of COVID-19 in North Macedonia; 25 in Slovenia; 13 in Croatia; six in Albania; five in Serbia; five in Bosnia; and zero in Montenegro.
yor: Bí á bá kà á ní méníméjì, ó ti tó ẹni méje tí ó ti kó àrùn COVID-19 ní North Macedonia; 25 ní Slovenia; 13 ní Croatia; mẹ́fà ní Albania; fi márùn-ún ní Serbia; márùn-ún ní Bosnia; òdo ní Montenegro.
mt0: <pad> Ṣe o mọ?</s>

en: There have been 28 cases in Romania and six in Bulgaria.
yor: Ó ti tó ẹni 28 tó ti kó o ní Romania, mẹ́fà ní Bulgaria.
mt0: <pad> 28 cases have been reported in Romania and six in Bulgaria.</s>

en: Christians elsewhere
yor: Onígbàgbọ́ níbi gbogbo
mt0: <pad> Ṣe o mọ Jesu nibẹ̀?</s>

en: The world has already witnessed how the novel coronavirus can spread through religious congregations.
yor: Ilé ayé ti rí bí coronavirus àkọ́kọ́ irú ẹ̀ ṣe lè ràn níbi ìpéjọ ajẹmẹ́sìn.
mt0: <pad> Agbègbè ti tẹlẹ ri bi coronavirus novel le ṣe wọpọ nipasẹ awọn ìjọsìn ẹ̀sìn.</s>

en: Last month, a majority of 7,400 confirmed cases of COVID-19 in South Korea — a country that until then seemed to have the outbreak under control — were traced to the group Shincheonji Church of Jesus.
yor: Lóṣù tó kọjá, ọ̀pọ̀ ènìyàn tí ó tó 7,400 ni a gbọ́ wí pé ó ti ní àrùn apànìyàn COVID-19 ní South Korea — orílẹ̀-èdè tí ó jọ pé ó ti ń gbá àrùn náà mọ́lẹ̀ — rí àrùn náà lára Iléèjọsìn ẹgbẹ́ Shincheonji ti Jésù.
mt0: <pad> Òṣù kẹ́yìn, àwọn ìdílé ní ìlú South Korea - ilẹ̀ tó sì dabi ẹni pé ó ti ní ìgbésí ìjìyàn lórí ìwọ̀n - ni a ṣe ìtọ́jú sí ìjọba Shincheonji Church of Jesus.</s>

en: Criminal charges were filed against the sect — often called a cult — and its 88-year-old leader publicly apologized.
yor: A fi ẹ̀sùn ọ̀daràn kan ẹgbẹ́ náà — tí wọ́n máa ń pè ní igbẹ́-ìmùlẹ̀ — olórí ẹgbẹ́ náà tí í ṣe ẹni 8-ọdún wá síta láti ṣe ìtọrọ àforíjì.
mt0: <pad> Ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìdánwò ní wọ́n fi sẹ́gbẹ́ náà sílẹ̀, àti pé olori wọn, ẹni ọdún 88 sọ̀rọ̀ gbangba.</s>

en: Meanwhile, the Orthodox Diocese of Korea announced changes in its liturgical practices in accordance with the recommendations of the Ministry of Health:
yor: Ní tirẹ̀, Àjọ Ìlànà-ìsìn Àtijọ́ ti Korea ṣe ìfilọ̀ nípa àwọn àyípadà tó dé bá ìsìn rẹ̀ ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú àfilélẹ̀ Iléeṣẹ́ Ètò Ìlera:
mt0: <pad> While the Orthodox Diocese of Korea announced changes in its liturgical practices in accordance with the recommendations of the Ministry of Health.</s>

en: 1. During the Divine Liturgy all believers will wear masks.
yor: 1. Gbogbo onígbàgbọ́ yóò wọ ìbomúbẹnu lásìkò tí ìsìn bá ń lọ lọ́wọ́.
mt0: <pad> 1. During the Divine Liturgy all believers will wear masks.</s>

en: 2. Before entering the Church, they will disinfect their hands with a disinfectant present at the entrance of the Church.
yor: 2. Kí wọ́n ó wọ Iléèjọsìn, wọ́n yóò fi apakòkòrò tó wà lẹ́nu àbáwọlé Iléèjọsìn ra ọwọ́ wọn.
mt0: <pad> 2. Before entering the Church, they will disinfect their hands with a disinfectant present at the entrance of the Church.</s>

en: 3. They will not shake hands with anyone.
yor: 3. Wọn kò ní gba ẹnìkan lọ́wọ́.
mt0: <pad> 3. They won't shake hands with anybody.</s>

en: 4. They will not kiss the hand of the Clergy.
yor: 4. Wọn kò ní f'ẹnu ko Àlùfáà ìjọ lọ́wọ́.
mt0: <pad> 4. They will not kiss the hand of the Clergy.</s>

en: 5. They will not kiss the Icons, but they will bow before them.
yor: 5. Wọn kò ní fẹnu ko àwọn Ère, àmọ́ wọn ó tẹríba níwájú wọn.
mt0: <pad> 5 Òun kò lè kiss àwọn Icons, ṣùgbọ́n wọ́n yóò sì bọ̀ níwájú wọn.</s>

en: 6. They will not use the liturgical books at the time of prayer.
yor: 6. Wọn kò ní lo àwọn ìwé àdúrà nígbà ìsìn.
mt0: <pad> 6. Wọn kì í lo àwọn ìwé ìjọsìn nígbà tí wọ́n bá gbadura.</s>

en: 7. They will not receive the Antidoron from the Clergy, but on their own as they leave the church.
yor: 7. Wọn kò ní gba Àkàrà lọ́wọ́ Àlùfáà ìjọ, àmọ́ fúnra wọn bí wọ́n bá ń jáde kúrò nínú iléèjọsìn.
mt0: <pad> 7 Òun kò lè gba Antidote láti àwọn ìjọba, ṣugbọn nípasè ara wọn nígbàtí wọ́n yí kúrò ní ìjọba.</s>

en: 8. The Agape Meal will not be served following the Sunday Liturgy.
yor: 8. Oúnjẹ Àpèjẹ Ifẹ̀ kò ní jẹ́ pínpín lọ́jọ́ Àìkú.
mt0: <pad> 8. The Agape Meal will not be served after the Sunday Liturgy.</s>

en: 9. The various group meetings of the Faithful as well as the Catechumens will not take place.
yor: 9. Àwọn ìpàdé ẹlẹ́gbẹ́jẹgbẹ́ àti ti àwọn tó ń kọ́ ìsìn Ọlọ́run kò ní wáyé.
mt0: <pad> 9. Awọn ìjọpọ̀ àwọn Ẹlẹ́gbọ́n àti àwọn Ẹlẹ́kọ́ kò lè lọ sílẹ̀.</s>

en: Some churches in Europe have adopted similar measures, such as the Catholic church in Italy.
yor: Àwọn ilé ìjọsìn kan ní Ilẹ̀ Gẹ̀ẹ́sì ti ń ṣe àyípadà sí ìlànà ìsìn wọn, bí i ìjọ Àgùdà ti Italy.
mt0: <pad> Awọn ijọsin diẹ ni Europe ti gba iru awọn igbese, bii Catholic Church ni Italy.</s>

en: The diocese in Croatia have also enacted restrictive rules and, in France, a pilgrimage site in the city of Lourdes has been shut down.
yor: Àjọ ẹ̀sìn ìgbàgbọ́ Croatia náà en ti ṣ'òfin tó dá lé àrùn náà, ní France, ibi ìrìnàjò mímọ kan ní ìlú Lourdes ti di títì pa.
mt0: <pad> diocese in croatia have also enacted restrictive rules and, in france, a pilgrimage site in the city of Lourdes has been shut down.</s>

en: The Orthodox Church of Romania issued a decree announcing "exceptional measures taken only because of the threat of an epidemic":
yor: Iléèjọsìn Ìlànà-ìsìn Àtijọ́ ti Romania fi òfin kan síta "tó jẹ́ àwọn ìgbésẹ̀ tí ènìyàn yóò tẹ̀lé bí àjàkálẹ̀ bá dúkokò":
mt0: <pad> Orthodox Church of Romania issued a decree announcing "measures exceptional taken only because of the danger of an epidemic."</s>

en: Believers who are afraid of virus transmission may temporarily refrain from kissing the holy icons in the churches.
yor: Àwọn onígbàgbọ́ tíbẹ̀rùbojo àrùn apànìyàn náà ti sojo s'ọ́kan wọn yóò pa ìfènuko àwọn ère inú ilé ìjọsìn lára.
mt0: <pad> Ẹ̀yìn tí ó bá ní ìrìnnà kòròrò lè jẹ́ kí wọn kúrò nínú kíkọ́ àwọn ìsìnkú ìdílé ní ìjọba.</s>

en: They can exceptionally ask the priest to use their own spoon for the Holy Communion.
yor: Bí ó bá wù wọ́n, wọ́n leè sọ fún àlùfáà wí pé ṣíbí ti wọn ni àwọn fẹ́ lò fi gba Ẹ̀jẹ̀ Olúwa mu.
mt0: <pad> Ìwọ kò mọ́.</s>

en: After Italy enacted a complete lockdown on national territory, other European states, like the Czech Republic also took more drastic measures on March 10, such as the closure of schools.
yor: Lẹ́yìn tí Italy pàṣẹ pé kí gbogbo orígun mẹ́rẹ̀ẹ̀rin ìlú ó di sísé pa, àwọn alámùúlégbè, bí i Ilẹ̀ Olómìnira Czech náà gbé àwọn àgbékalẹ̀ kan lọ́jọ́ 10, oṣù Ẹrẹ́nà tí wọ́n ṣán àwọniiléèwé pa.
mt0: <pad> lẹ́yìn tí Italy ti gbé ìlú náà sí ìsùn ìgbà kan, àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè Yuropi, bí Czech Republic, ti gba àwọn ìlànà ìṣòro ní March 10, pẹ̀lú ìsùn ìwé.</s>

en: The Government of North Macedonia declared a state of emergency and also shut down kindergardens, schools, and universities for two weeks.
yor: Ìjọba North Macedonia kéde ipò ìlú ò f'ara rọ, ó sì ti àwọn jẹ́léósinmi, iléèwé, títí kan iléèwé gíga jù lọ Ifásitìi pa fún ọ̀sẹ̀ méjì.
mt0: <pad> Òun kò mọ̀</s>

mt0: <pad> Nigeria enforces travel bans amid sloppy management of COVID-19</s>

mt0: <pad> Ṣe ìwé ìṣọ́ àwọn orílẹ̀èdè 13 pẹlu ẹ̀yìn 1,000 kọjá COVID-19 ní ìwọ̀n.</s>
