en: Meanwhile the Education Secretariat of the Federal Capital Territory Administration FCTA, has issued a warning to some private Schools disseminating information to parents and students indicating the resumption of the 2019/2020 3rd term calendar online.
yor: Bákan náà, ilé-iṣẹ́ ẹ̀kọ́ tó ń ṣàmójútó àwọn ilé-è̩kó̩ ní olú-ìlú FCTA, ṣe ìkìlọ̀ fún àwọn ilé-è̩kó̩ aládàáni tí wọ́n ń dájọ́ ìwọlé táàmù kẹta fún 2019/2020 lórí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára fún àwọn òbí àti akẹ́kọ̀ọ́.
mt0: <pad> Ṣe o mọ ọjọ́ ìwé rẹ̀?</s>

en: The FCTA Education Secretary, Umaru Marafa said in a statement released on Tuesday that no academic activities in all Schools in any form should commence until a notice to reopen is approved and conveyed by the Secretariat”
yor: Akọ̀wé ilé-iṣẹ́ àjọ tó ń mójútó ilé-è̩kó̩, Umaru Marafa sọ nínú àtẹ̀jáde ọjọ́ ìṣẹ́gun wípé kò sí iṣẹ́ ìkẹ́kọ̀ọ́ kọ̀kan ní ilé-è̩kó̩ kọ̀ọ̀kan lọ́nàkọnà tó gbọ́dọ̀ bẹ̀rẹ̀ títí di ìgbà tí àṣẹ s̩ís̩í ilé ìwé bá jáde.
mt0: <pad> FCTA Education Secretary, Umaru Marafa said in a statement released on Tuesday that no academic activities in all Schools in any form should commence until a notice to reopen is approved and conveyed by the Secretariat”</s>

en: “The Implication of this is that when the Schools will be reopened, adequate notice of the fact that 2nd term was inconclusive will be factored into the academic calendar which will dovetail into the 3rd term accordingly. Any action taken otherwise is likely to negatively distort the academic calendar of the schools involved” Marafa said.
yor: Marafa so̩ pé, “Ìtumò̩ èyí ni pé nígbà tí àwọn ilé-è̩kó̩ yóò bá di s̩ís̩í padà, ìfilọ̀ tí ó yé̩ ni yóò ti wà lórí táàmù kejì tí kò parí, àti ò̩nà àti runmó̩ táàmù kẹta bí ó ti yẹ. Ìgbésè̩ tó bá lòdì sí èyí ṣeéṣe kó kóbá ètò ẹ̀kọ́ àwọn ilé-è̩kó̩ tó kàn.
mt0: <pad> “The Implication of this is that when the Schools will be reopened, adequate notice of the fact that 2nd term was inconclusive will be factored into the academic calendar which will dovetail into the 3rd term accordingly. Any action taken otherwise is likely to negatively distort the academic calendar of the schools involved” Marafa said.</s>

en: School proprietors are therefore, advised to maintain the status quo and keep their schools closed and not re-open in any form while they await further directives from the FCTA.
yor: Wó̩n ro̩ àwọn ọ̀gá ilé-è̩kó̩ aláàdáni láti sowé-agbéjé̩-mó̩wó̩ kí ilé-è̩kó̩ wò̩n sì wà látìpa, kí wọ́n má s̩e si ní ọ̀nàkọnà títí ìjò̩ba yóò fi sohun mìíràn.
mt0: <pad> Òun kò mọ̀.</s>

en: Violators of this directive will face the full wrath of the law.
yor: Àwọn tí wọ́n bá ṣe lòdì sí àṣẹ yìí yóò dojúkọ ìdájọ́ òfin pó̩nńbélé;
mt0: <pad> Òun kò mọ̀.</s>

en: Marafa further disclosed that the FCTA Education Secretariat has concluded plans to introduce e-learning platforms to include lessons on radio and television channels to keep the students constructively engaged while the lockdown lasts.
yor: Marafa tún sọ wípé ilé-iṣẹ́ ẹ̀kọ́ ìjọba àpapọ̀ ti parí gbogbo ètò láti leè mú ètò ẹ̀kọ́ lórí ayélujára w̩onú èto ẹ̀kọ́ yálà lóri rédíò tàbí te̩lifís̩àn kí àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ leè máa ṣiṣẹ́ nígbogbo ìgbà tí kónílé gbélé bá fiwà.
mt0: <pad> Marafa further disclosed that the FCTA Education Secretariat has concluded plans to introduce e-learning platforms to include lectures on radio and television channels to keep the students constructively engaged while the lockdown lasts.</s>

en: --- No private school must start work –  Minister FCT
yor: --- Kò gbọ̣̣̣̣̣dọ̣̀ ṣí ilé-ìwé aládàáni kankan tó gbọ̣́dọ̣̀ bẹ̣̀rẹ̣̀ isẹ̣́ – Mínísítà FCT
mt0: <pad> No private school must start work – Minister FCT</s>

en: The Minister for the Federal capital territory (FCT), Alhaji Muhammad Musa Bello has warned the proprietors of private schools in Abuja that have started informing parents and students that very soon they will start work for the third term for the present 2019/2020 academic session, to be careful so that they will not face the wrath of government law.
yor: Mínísítà fún olú-ìlú Nàìjíríà, Alhaji Muhammad Músá Bello ti ṣ̣èkìlọ̀ fún gbogbo àwọ̣̣n olùdarí ilé-ìwé aládàáni tó wà nílùú Àbújá tí wọ́n ti ń sọ̣̣ fún gbogbo àwọ̣̣n òbí àti akẹ̣̣́kọ̣̀ọ́ pé wọ̣̣n kò ní pẹ́ bẹ̣̀rẹ̣̀ iṣ̣ẹ́ láìpẹ̣́ fún sáà kẹ̣̣ta fún ti ọ̣dún 2019/2020 tí a wàyìí láti ṣ̣ọ̣̣́ra, kí wọ̣̣́n máa ba fojụ winá òfin ìjọ̣̣ba.
mt0: <pad> Òun kò mọ̀</s>

en: Senior secretary for education in the federal capital territory, Umaru Marafa said this in a statement released on Tuesday that no academic activities in all Schools in any form should commence until a notice to reopen is approved and conveyed by the Secretariat”
yor: Akọ̣̣̀wé àgbà fún ètò ẹ̣̣̀kọ́ nílùú Àbújá, Umaru Máráfá  ló sọ̣̣̀rọ̣̣̀ yíì nínú àtẹ̀jáde kan tí ó gbé jáde lọ̣̣́jọ́ ìṣ̣ẹ̣̣́gun pé ètò ẹ̣̣̀kọ́  kò ní tíì bẹ̣̣̀rẹ̀ nílé ìwé kankan tó wà nílùú Àbújá báyìí àyàfi ọjọ́ tí ilé-iṣ̣ẹ́  akọ̀wé àgbà fún ètò ẹ̣̣̀kọ́ bá fọ̣̣wọ̣̣́si.
mt0: <pad> Òun kò mọ̀</s>

en: “We are appealing to private school proprietors to allow all their schools to remain closed, they must not try to open the school except there is a  notice or guideline from ministry of FCTA”
yor: "À ń rọ̣̣ gbogbo àwọ̣̣n olùdarí ilé-è̩kó̩ aládàáni láti jẹ́ kí ilé-è̩kó̩ wà ní títìpa, wọn kò gbọ̣̣̣dọ̣̣̀ gbìyànjú láti ṣí ilé-è̩kó̩ náà àfi tí àṣ̣ẹ̣̣ tàbí ìlànà bá wá láti ọ̀dọ̀ ilé-iṣ̣ẹ́ FCTA."
mt0: <pad> “A n sọ fun awọn oluṣọgba ile-iwe ti o ni ikọle lati fi gbogbo ile-iwe wọn silẹ, wọn gbọdọ̀ máa gbìyànjú lati ṣii ile-iwe wọn ayafi ti wọn ba gba awọn aṣẹ ati awọn imọran lati ọdọ́ Ẹgbẹ́ FCTA.</s>

en: All those that go against this rule shall face the wrath of law.
yor: Gbogbo àwọ̣̣n tó bá tàpá ṣófin yìí ni yóò fojú winá òfin ìjọ̣̣ba.
mt0: <pad> Òun mọ̀ pé gbogbo àwọn tí ó bá ìlànà yìí lọ́wọ́ gbọ́dọ̀ ní ìfẹ̀ òfin.</s>

en: Marafa continued that Ministry of FCTA in charge of education has planned to start teaching by using the knowledge of internet, the use of television to teach the students in the period of lockdown.
yor: Máràfá tẹ̀síwájú pé ilé-iṣ̣ẹ́ FCTA tí ó ń mójútó ètò ẹ̣̀kọ́ ti s̩e ètò láti bẹ̀rẹ̀ ètò ẹ̀kọ́ nípa lílo ìmọ̀ ayélujára, àti s̩ís̩e àmúlò te̩lifís̩àn láti fi kọ̣́ àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ní àkókò kónílé-gbélé.
mt0: <pad> Marafa continued that the Ministry of FCTA in charge of education has planned to start teaching by using the knowledge of internet, the use of television to teach the students during the period of lockdown.</s>

en: --- FULL TEXT OF PRESIDENT MUHAMMADU BUHARI’S NATIONWIDE BROADCAST
yor: --- Ọ̀RỌ̀ ÀÀRẸ MUHAMMADU BUHARI LÓRI TE̩LIFÍS̩ÀN SỌ́MỌ NÀÌJÍRÍÀ
mt0: <pad> Ìwé ìgbàlódé àwọn ọmọ ìlú Muhammadu Buhari ní ìpínlẹ̀ náà.</s>

en: ADDRESS BY H.E. MUHAMMADU BUHARI, PRESIDENT OF THE FEDERAL REPUBLIC OF NIGERIA ON THE CUMULATIVE LOCKDOWN ORDER OF LAGOS AND OGUN STATES AS WELL AS THE FEDERAL CAPITAL TERRITORY ON COVID- 19 PANDEMIC AT THE STATE HOUSE, ABUJA, MONDAY, 27th APRIL, 2020
yor: Ọ̀RỌ̀ ÀÀRẸ ORÍLẸ̀-ÈDÈ NÀ̀ÌJÍRÍÀ, MUHAMMADU BUHARI, NÍPA ÒFIN KÓNÍLÉ-GBÉLÉ NÍ ÌPÍNLẸ̀ ÈKÓ, ÒGÙN ÀTI ÌLÚ ÀBÚJÁ, FCT, LÓRI  ÌTÀNKÁLẸ̀ ÀÀRÙN COVID- 19, NÍ ÈYÍ TÍ Ó WÁYÉ NÍ ÌLÚ ÀBÚJÁ LỌ́JỌ́ AJÉ, ỌJÓ̩ KẸTÀDÍNLỌ́GBỌ́N, OSÙ KẸRIN ,ỌDÚN 2020 (MONDAY, 27th APRIL, 2020).
mt0: <pad> ADDRESS BY H.E. Muhammadu Buhari, President of the Federal Republic of Nigeria on the cumulative lockdown order of Lagos and Ogun States as well as the Federal Capital Territory on COVID-19 pandemic at the State House, Abuja, Monday, 27th April, 2020</s>

en: 1. Fellow Nigerians
yor: 1.O̩mọ Nàìjíríà
mt0: <pad> 1. Fellow Nigerians</s>

en: 2. I will start by commending you all for the resilience and patriotism that you have shown in our collective fight against the biggest health challenge of our generation.
yor: 2.Màá bẹ̀rẹ̀ pè̩lú gbígbós̩ùbà fun yín nítorí ìwà akínkanjú àti ìjólóòótọ́ yín èyí tẹ s̩àfihàn nínú ìjà àjùmò̩jà sí ìpèníjà ìlera tó gajù, tó ń kojú ìran wa.
mt0: <pad> I will start by commending you all for the resilience and patriotism that you have shown in our collective fight against the biggest health challenge of our generation.</s>

en: 3. As at yesterday, 26th April 2020, some 3 million confirmed cases of COVID-19 have been recorded globally with about 900,000 recoveries. Unfortunately, some 200,000 people have passed away as a result of this pandemic.
yor: 3.Níwòyí àná, 26th April 2020, àgbáyé s̩àwárí àwo̩n alárùn Covid-19 míĺiọ̣́nù mẹ́ta, tí ẹ̀ẹ́dẹ́gbààrún ló̩nà e̩gbè̩rún ènìyàn sì ti gbàwòsàn. Ó ṣeni láàánú pé igba ló̩nà e̩gbè̩rún ènìyàn ló tipasè̩ ààrùn náà papò̩dà.
mt0: <pad> 3 As of yesterday, 26th April 2020, some 3 million confirmed cases of COVID-19 have been recorded globally with about 900,000 recoveries. Unfortunately, some 200,000 people have passed away as a result of this pandemic.</s>

en: 4. The health systems and economies of many nations continue to struggle as a result of the coronavirus pandemic.
yor: 4.Ètò ìlera àti ọrọ̀ ajé ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ orílẹ̀ èdè ni ó sì ń tiraka látàrí àjàkálẹ́ ààrùn kòkòrò kòrónà.
mt0: <pad> 4. Awọn eto abẹ́ẹ̀wò àti ìṣọ̀kan ọrọ̀ ajé ti ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ orílẹ̀èdè ń sẹ́yìn nítorí coronavirus pandemic.</s>

en: 5. Nigeria continues to adapt to these new global realities on a daily basis. Today, I will present the facts as they are and explain our plans for the coming months fully aware that some key variables and assumptions may change in the coming days or weeks.
yor: 5.Nàìjíríà ń tẹ̀síwájú láti máa mọ àwọn òótọ́ titun tó ń súyo̩ lágbàáyé lójoojúmó̩. Lónìí, n ó sọ àwọn òtítọ́ bó ṣe jẹ́, n ó sì ṣàl̀àyé àwọn ètò wa fún àwọn oṣu tó ń bọ̀ nígb̀atí a tí mọ̀ wípé àwọn ohun kan lè yípadà láwọn ọjọ́ àtọ̀sẹ̀ tó ń bọ̀.
mt0: <pad> 5 Nigeria n tẹsiwaju lati ṣe aṣayan si awọn ohun ti o wa ni ayika agbaye ni gbogbo ọjọ. Loni, mo yoo fi idi ti o wa ati ṣalaye awọn iṣẹlẹ wa fun awọn osu to nbo mọ pe diẹ ninu awọn aṣayan akọkọ ati assumptions le yipada ni awọn ọjọ to nbo tabi awọn ọsẹ to nbo.</s>

en: 6. Exactly two weeks ago, there were 323 confirmed cases in 20 States and the Federal Capital Territory.
yor: 6.Ní déédé ọ̀sẹ̀ méjì sẹ́yìn, oníkòrónà okòóléló̩ò̩dúnrún lé mé̩ta ni wó̩n s̩àwárí nípìnínlè̩ ogún àti olú-ìlú.
mt0: <pad> 6 Ṣe ọsẹ meji ṣaaju, 323 awọn iṣẹlẹ ti a fihan ni 20 ipinlẹ ati agbegbe Federal Capital Territory.</s>

en: 7. As at this morning, Nigeria had recorded 1,273 cases across 32 States and the FCT. Unfortunately, this includes 40 deaths.
yor: 7.`Lówùúrọ̀ yìí, Nàìjíríà ti lákọsílẹ̀ àádó̩rinlélè̩é̩gbé̩fà-lé-mé̩ta alárùn nípìnínlè̩ méjìlélọ́gbọ̀n àti olú-ìlú. Ó ṣeni láànú pé ogójì ló ti papòdà.
mt0: <pad> 7 As at this morning, Nigeria had recorded 1,273 cases across 32 States and the FCT. Unfortunately, this includes 40 deaths.</s>

en: 8. I am using this opportunity to express our deepest condolences to the families of all Nigerians that have lost their loved ones as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic. This is our collective loss and we share your grief.
yor: 8.Mò ń lo àǹfààní yìí láti fi ìbánikẹ́dùn wa hàn pẹ̀lú àwọn ẹbí ọmọ orílè̩-èdè Nàìjíríà gbogbo tí wọ́n pàdánù àwọn olólùfẹ́ wọn látàrí àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn COVID-19. Èyí jẹ́ àdánù wa papọ̀, a sì pín nínú ìbànújẹ́ yín.
mt0: <pad> 8 I am using this opportunity to express our deepest condolences to the families of all Nigerians who have lost their loved ones as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic. This is our collective loss and we share your grief.</s>

en: 9. Initial models predicted that Nigeria will record an estimated 2,000 confirmed cases in the first month after the index case.
yor: 9.Àwòye ìbè̩rè̩ ni pé Nàìjíríà máa ní e̩gbàá àko̩sílè̩ alárùn ní oṣù àkọ́kọ́ lé̩yìn tí wọ́n rí alárùn àkó̩kó̩.
mt0: <pad> 9. Initial models predicted that Nigeria will record an estimated 2,000 confirmed cases in the first month after the index case.</s>

en: 10. This means that despite the increase in the number of confirmed cases recorded in the past two weeks, the measures we have put in place thus far have yielded positive outcomes against the projections.
yor: 10.Èyí ni pé bí iye àwọn tí àyẹ̀wò so̩ pé wọ́n ní ààrùn kòrónà ní ọ̀sẹ̀ méjì sẹ́yìn ti pọ̀ tó, àwọn ohun ta ti ṣàgbékalè̩ ti mú èso rere jáde lòdì síwòye àná.
mt0: <pad> 10 Eyi tumọ si pe awọn igbasilẹ ti o pọ si ni ọsẹ meji to kọja, awọn igbesẹ ti a ti fi sinu iṣẹ ṣiṣe nigba yii ti ṣe awọn esi rere lori awọn iṣiro.</s>

en: 11. The proportion of cases imported from other countries has reduced to only 19% of new cases, showing that our border closures yielded positive results. These are mostly fellow Nigerians returning through our land borders. We will continue to enforce land border arrival protocols as part of the containment strategy.
yor: 11.Iye alárùn kòrónà tó tòkè òkun wá ti dínkù sìdá mó̩kàndínlógún nínú o̩gó̩rùn-ún àwo̩n alárùn titun, èyí fihàn pé títi e̩nubodè sèso rere. Ò̩pò̩lo̩pò̩ ni àwo̩n o̩mo̩ Nàìjíríà  tó ń padabò̩ wálé. A ó tẹ̀síwájú nínú títe̩pe̩le̩ mó̩ ìlànà gbígba àwo̩n as̩è̩s̩è̩dé gé̩gé̩ bi ọ̀nà láti gbógun tààrùn yìí.
mt0: <pad> 11. The proportion of imported cases has reduced to only 19% of new cases, showing that our border closures yielded positive results. These are mostly fellow Nigerians returning through our land borders. We will continue to enforce land border arrival protocols as part of the containment strategy.</s>

en: 12. Today, the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) has accredited 15 laboratories across the country with an aggregate capacity to undertake 2,500 tests per day across the country.
yor: 12.Lónìí, àjọ amójútó àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà ti fi ọwọ́ sí àwọn ilé ìyẹ̀wò mẹ́ẹ̀dógún tó lè ṣe àyẹ̀wò fún ènìyàn tó tó è̩é̩dé̩gbè̩tàlá lójúmọ́ jákèjádò orílẹ̀ èdè.
mt0: <pad> Awọn ọjọ wọnyi, Ile-iṣẹ Iṣakoso Aarun (NCDC) ti ṣe awọn ile-iwosan 15 ni gbogbo orilẹ-ede pẹlu agbara gbogbogbo lati ṣe awọn idanwo 2,500 fun ọjọ kan ni gbogbo orilẹ-ede.</s>

en: 13. Based on your feedback, Lagos State Government and the FCT with support from NCDC have established several sample collection centers. They are also reviewing their laboratory testing strategy to further increase the number of tests they can perform including the accreditation of selected private laboratories that meet the accreditation criteria.
yor: 13.Látàrí èsì yín, ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó àti ìlú Àbújá pẹ̀lú àtìlẹ́yìn àjọ agbógun ti àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn ti ṣe àgbékalẹ̀ ibùdó ìgbàyèwò onírúúurú. Wọ́n tún ṣàgbéyẹ̀wò ète ìs̩àyè̩wò ní àwo̩n yàrá àyè̩wò láti lè mú kí àyè̩wò s̩ís̩e pò̩ sí pè̩lú ibùdó àyè̩wò aládàáni tí ó kojú òs̩ùnwò̩n tí wó̩n fo̩wó̩sí.
mt0: <pad> 13 Based on your feedback, Lagos State Government and the FCT with support from NCDC have established several sample collection centers. They are also reviewing their laboratory testing strategy to further increase the number of tests they can perform including the accreditation of selected private laboratories that meet the accreditation criteria.</s>

en: 14. Several new fully equipped treatment and isolation centres have been operationalised across the country thereby increasing bed capacity to about three thousand.
yor: 14.Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ilé-ìtójú gidi àti ìbùdó ìyàsọ́tọ̀ titun tìbè̩rè̩ iṣẹ́ jákèjádò orílẹ̀-èdè yìí, èyí sì mú kí iye ìbùsùn fé̩ tó ẹgbẹ̀é̩dógún.
mt0: <pad> 14 Several new fully equipped treatment and isolation centres have been operationalised across the country thereby increasing bed capacity to about three thousand.</s>

en: 15. I commend the State Governors for the activation of State-level Emergency Operation Centres, establishment of new treatment centres and the delivery of aggressive risk communication strategies.
yor: 15.Mo yin àwo̩n Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ fúndàásílẹ̀ ibùdó ìdásí ní pàjáwìrì nípìnínlẹ̀, ìdásílẹ̀ àwọn ibùdó ìtójú tuntun àti ète bíba àwo̩n ènìyàn sò̩rò̩ gidigidi lórí ewu tó wà.
mt0: <pad> 15. I commend the State Governors for the activation of State-level Emergency Operation Centres, the establishment of new treatment centres and the delivery of aggressive risk communication strategies.</s>

en: 16. Over 10,000 healthcare workers have been trained. For their protection, additional personal protective equipment have been distributed to all the states.
yor: 16.E̩gbẹ̀rún mẹ́wàá òṣìṣẹ́ ìlera lé, la ti kọ́. Fún ààbò won, àwọn èlò ìdáàbòbò mìíràn la ti fi s̩o̩wó̩ sáwo̩n ìpínlẹ̀.
mt0: <pad> 16 Above 10,000 health workers have been trained. For their protection, more personal protective equipment has been distributed to all the states.</s>

en: 17. Although we have experienced logistical challenges, we remain committed to establishing a solid supply chain process to ensure these heroic professionals can work safely and are properly equipped.
yor: 17.Nítòótọ́ a ti ní ìrírí àwọn ìpèníjà kan, a dúró digbi lóri s̩ís̩àgbékalè̩ ìpèsè tí ó múnádoko kí àwo̩n òs̩ìs̩é̩ yìí s̩is̩é̩ láìsí ewu pè̩lú ìs̩o̩ra pípé.
mt0: <pad> 17. Biotilejepe a ti ni awọn iṣoro logistical, a duro si lati ṣeto eto nkan ipese ti o lagbara lati rii daju pe awọn ọmọ ogun akọni yii le ṣiṣẹ lailewu ati pe wọn ti ṣeto daradara.</s>

en: 18. In keeping with our Government’s promise to improve the welfare of healthcare workers, we have signed a memorandum of understanding on the provision of hazard allowances and other incentives with key health sector professional associations.
yor: 18.́Ni mímú ìlérí ìjọba wa ṣe láti mú kí ìgbé ayé àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ìlera wa dára si, a ti fi ọwọ́ sí ìwé àdéhùn olóye fún ìpèsè owó ìfẹ̀míwewu àti àwọn owó mìíràn pẹ̀lú àwọn ẹgbẹ́ akọ́ṣẹ́mọṣẹ́ ẹ̀ka ètò ìlera tí ó ṣe kókọ.
mt0: <pad> 18. In line with our Government's commitment to improve the welfare of healthcare workers, we have signed a memorandum of understanding on the provision of hazard allowances and other incentives with key health sector professional associations.</s>

en: 19. We have also procured insurance cover for 5,000 frontline health workers. At this point, I must commend the insurance sector for their support in achieving this within a short period of time.
yor: 19.A ti s̩ètò ìdójútòfò fún àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ìlera tó ń léwájú bíi ẹgbẹ̀rún márùn-ún. Níkòóríta yìí mo gbọ́dọ̀ kí àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ adójútòfò fún àtìlẹyìn wọn ní ṣíṣe èyí láàrín àkókò díè.
mt0: <pad> 19. A ti ṣe awọn idogo idogo fun 5,000 awọn oṣiṣẹ ilera akọkọ. Nibi, Mo gbọdọ̀ yìn awọn ile-iṣẹ idogo fun iranlọwọ wọn lati ṣe eyi ni akoko kukuru.</s>

en: 20. Nigeria has also continued to receive support from the international community, multilateral agencies, the private sector and public-spirited individuals. This support has ensured that critical lifesaving equipment and materials, which have become scarce globally, are available for Nigeria through original equipment manufacturers and government-to-government processes.
yor: 20.Nàìj́iríà sì ń gbàrànlọ́wọ́ láti àwọn orílẹ̀ àgbáyé láti àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ káàkiri, ẹgbẹ́ aládàáni àti ẹnìkọ̀ọ̀kan. Àtìlẹyìn yìí ti jẹ́ káwọn irinṣẹ́ àtohun èlò ta fi ń dóòlà ẹ̀mí, èyí tó sò̩wọ́n ní àgbáyé ti wà fún Nàìjírị́à látipaṣẹ̀ àwọn àjọ tó ń ṣe irinṣẹ́ gidi àtètò ìjọba-sí-ìjọba.
mt0: <pad> Nigeria has also continued to receive support from the international community, multilateral agencies, the private sector and public-spirited individuals. This support has ensured that critical lifesaving equipment and materials, which have become scarce globally, are available for Nigeria through original equipment manufacturers and government-to-government processes.</s>

en: 21. The distribution and expansion of palliatives which I directed in my earlier broadcast is still on-going in a transparent manner. I am mindful of the seeming frustration being faced by expectant citizens. I urge all potential beneficiaries to exercise patience as we continue to fine tune our logistical and distribution processes working with the State Governments.
yor: 21.Pínpín àti ìgbòòrò àwọn ohun ìtura lásìkò kónílé -gbélé tí mo sọ nínú ìkéde ìs̩áájú sì ń tẹ̀síwájú láìléèérú nínú. Mo mọ ìsúni tí àwọn ọmọ orílẹ-èdè yìí tó ń retí rẹ̀ ń kojú. Mo ṛo̩ gbogbo ẹ̀yin anípìn-ín nínú rẹ̀ láti ni ́sùúrù bí a ti ń wá ọ̀nà tó dára láti pín pẹ̀lu àwọn ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀.
mt0: <pad> 21. The distribution and expansion of palliatives which I directed in my earlier broadcast is still on-going in a transparent way. I am mindful of the seeming frustration being faced by expectant citizens. I urge all potential beneficiaries to exercise patience as we continue to fine tune our logistical and distribution processes working with the State Governments.</s>

en: 22. Our Security Agencies continue to rise to the challenge posed by this unusual situation. While we feel deeply concerned about isolated security incidents, I want to assure all Nigerians that your safety and security remain our primary concern especially in these difficult and uncertain times.
yor: 22.Àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ alábòò wa tẹ́síwájú láti dìde sípèníjà àsìkò ajo̩nilójú yìí. Bó tilè̩ jé̩ pé ìs̩è̩lè̩ ààbò ibùdó ìyàsó̩tò̩ dùn wá gan-an, mo fẹ́ fiyé ọmọ Nàìjíríà pé ààbò àti è̩s̩ó̩ yín jé̩ àkó̩kó̩ sí wa, pàápàá jùlọ ní àkókò líle òun àìmò̩ yìí.
mt0: <pad> 22 Awọn Ẹgbẹ́ Àṣà ìsàlẹ̀ ìlú wa ń tẹ́siwaju láti ṣe ìgbésẹ̀ tí ìsàlẹ̀ ìsàlẹ̀ yí ní. Nígbàtí mo mọ̀ pé a ní ìfẹ̀ sí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìsàlẹ̀ ìsàlẹ̀, Mo fẹ́ kí gbogbo àwọn ará Nigerians mọ̀ pé ààbò àti ìsàlẹ̀ ìsàlẹ̀ rẹ̀ jẹ́ ohun tó ní ìfẹ̀ sí wa, pàápàá ni àwọn ọjọ́ ìsàlẹ̀ ìsàlẹ̀ yìí.</s>

en: 23. As we focus on protecting lives and properties, we will not tolerate any human rights abuse by our security agencies. The few reported incidences are regrettable, and I want to assure you that the culprits will be brought to justice.
yor: 23.Bá ṣe ń bójútó ààbò è̩mí àti dúkìá a kò ní fààyè gba ì-tẹ-ẹ̀tọ́-ọmọnìyàn mólẹ̀ láti ọ̀dọ̀ òṣìṣẹ́ aláàbò. Àwọn ìròyìn ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ díẹ̀ tá a gbọ́ jẹ́ èyí tó ṣeni láàánú, mo sì fẹ́ fi dáa yín lójú pé a ó mú àwọn ọ̀daràn náà láti kojú ìdájọ òfin.
mt0: <pad> Òóò ìí ñâîé áûëè íà ñòðàçè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåðè íà òåð

en: 24. I urge all Nigerians to continue to cooperate and show understanding whenever they encounter security agents. Furthermore, for their protection, I have instructed that the personnel of all the security agencies be provided with the necessary personal protective equipment against infection.
yor: 24.Mo rọ gbogbo ọmọ Nàìjíríà láti tẹ̀síwájú nínú ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ àti ìfòyehàn nínú ìpàdé wo̩n àti òṣìṣẹ́ aláàbò. Síwájú si, fún ààbò wọn, mo ti pàṣẹ pé kí wó̩n fún àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ aláàbò wọ̀nyí ní irinṣẹ́ ìdáàbòbò ara wo̩n lọ́wọ́ àkóràn ààrùn yìí.
mt0: <pad> 24. Mo rọ gbogbo awọn ara Nigeria lati tẹsiwaju lati ṣiṣẹ pẹlu awọn ọlọpa nigba ti wọn ba pade wọn. Ni afikun, fun aabo wọn, mo ti paṣẹ pe awọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ awọn ile-iṣẹ aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju aṣoju

en: 25. As we continue to streamline our response in the centres of Lagos and the FCT, I am gravely concerned about the unfortunate developments in Kano in recent days. Although an in-depth investigation is still on-going, we have decided to deploy additional Federal Government manpower, material and technical resources to strengthen and support the State Government’s efforts, with immediate effect.
yor: 25.Bá ti ń tẹ̀síwájú láti mú àdínkùn bá ìdáhùn wa láwọn ibùdó tÈkó àtÀbújá, ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ní Kánò láìpẹ́ yìí tún bàmí-nínú-jẹ́. Bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ìwá̀díi kíkún ń tẹ̀síwájú, a ti pinnu láti s̩àfikún òṣìṣẹ́ ìjọba àpapọ̀, ohun èlò àti ìrànwó̩ peléke láti kín àti s̩àtìlẹ́yìn akitiyan ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀, ní ló̩gán.
mt0: <pad> 25 As we continue to streamline our response in the centres of Lagos and the FCT, I am gravely concerned about the unfortunate developments in Kano in recent days. Although an in-depth investigation is still on-going, we have decided to deploy additional Federal Government manpower, material and technical resources to strengthen and support the State Government’s efforts, with immediate effect.</s>

en: 26. In Kano, and indeed many other States that are recording new cases, preliminary findings show that such cases are mostly from interstate travel and emerging community transmission.
yor: 26.Ní Kánò, àti ìpínlẹ̀ yòókù tó ń s̩àkọsílẹ̀ alárùn tuntun, ìwádìí àkọ́kọ́ so pé àwọn èsì àyẹ̀wò yìí níí s̩e pè̩lú ìrìnàjò ìpínlẹ̀sípìnínlẹ̀ àti ìtànkálè̩ ààrùn nílùú kan.
mt0: <pad> 26 Ni Kano, ati ni gbogbo awọn ipinlẹ miiran ti o n ṣe iroyin awọn ọran tuntun, awọn iwadi akọkọ fihan pe awọn ọran bẹẹ ni o wa ni idapọ̀ ìrìnàjò àti ìsílẹ̀ agbegbe.</s>

en: 27. Drawing from these, I implore all Nigerians to continue to adhere strictly to the advisories published by the Presidential Task Force and the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control.
yor: 27.Lati inú èyí, mo rọ gbogbo ọmọ Nàìjíríà kí wọ́n ó tẹ̀síwájú láti máa tẹ̀lé ìmọ̀ràn àwọn ikọ̀ amúṣẹ́ṣe ààrẹ àti àwọn àjo tí ó ń mójútó ààrùn
mt0: <pad> 27 Drawing from these, I implore all Nigerians to continue to adhere strictly to the advisories issued by the Presidential Task Force and the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control.</s>

en: 28. These include regular hand washing, physical distancing, wearing of face masks/coverings in public, avoidance of non-essential movement and travels and avoidance of large gatherings.
yor: 28.Àwọn èyí ni, fífọwọ́ lóòrèkóòrè, jíjìnà síra e̩ni, lílo ìbomú nígbangba, yíyàgò fún òde ìwò̩fún pè̩lú ìrìnàjò àti yíyàgò fún ìpéjọpọ̀ elérò púpọ̀.
mt0: <pad> 28 Wọn pẹlu ọwọ mimọ, awọn iyọ̀lẹ̀ ara, awọn ibọwọ̀ oju/aṣọ́ àti ìgbéjáde ní ìlú, ìfẹ̀rẹ̀ ìrìnnà àti irin-ajo àti ìfẹ̀rẹ̀ ìjọpọ̀ to ńlá.</s>

en: 29. Fellow Nigerians, for the past four weeks, most parts of our country have been under either Federal Government or State Government lockdown. As I mentioned earlier, these steps were necessary and overall, have contributed to slowing down the spread of COVID-19 in our country.
yor: 29.Ẹ̣̣̀yin ọmo Nàìjíríà, fún bí ọ̀sẹ̀ mẹ́rin sẹ́yìn lọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ibì lórílẹ̀èdè wa lábẹ àṣẹ kónílégbélé ti ìjọba àpapọ̀ tàbí ti ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀. Bí mo s̩e sọ ṣáájú, àwọn ìgbésẹ̀ yìí ṣe pàtàkì àti pé ó tún kópa nínu mímú àdínkù bá ìtànkálè̩ Kòrónà lórílẹ̀èdè wa.
mt0: <pad> 29 Fellow Nigerians, fun awọn ọsẹ mẹrin to kọja, ọpọlọpọ awọn apakan ti orilẹ-ede wa ti wa labẹ Federal Government tabi State Government lockdown. Bi mo ti sọ tẹlẹ, awọn igbesẹ wọnyi ni o ṣe pataki ati gbogbo, ti ṣe iranlọwọ lati dinku itankale COVID-19 ni orilẹ-ede wa.</s>

en: 30. However, such lockdowns have also come at a very heavy economic cost. Many of our citizens have lost their means of livelihood. Many businesses have shut down. No country can afford the full impact of a sustained lockdown while awaiting the development of vaccines.
yor: 30.Síbẹ̀síbẹ̀, irú àṣẹ kónílé gbélé náà ti wà pẹ̀lú ètò ìsúnná tó pọ̀. Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọmọ orílẹ̀èdè wa ti pàdánù ọ̀nà ìjẹun. Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ iṣẹ́ ló ti dúró. Kò sí orílẹ̀èdè tó lè gba gbogbo àkóbá kónílé-gbélé se nígbà à ń retí èsì ayò̩ lórí abẹ́rẹ́ àjẹsára.
mt0: <pad> Ṣugbọn, iru awọn ìṣọ́ yìí ti sọ̀rọ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn owó ọrọ̀ ajé tó pọ̀. Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ará ilé iṣẹ́ wa ti sùn. Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ìṣọ́ ti sùn. Ko si orílẹ̀èdè tí ó le jẹ́ kí o ní ìfẹ̀ sí ìfẹ̀ sí ìṣọ́ yìí nígbàtí o n duro àti ìwádìí ìṣẹ́gun ìṣọ́.</s>

en: 31. In my last address, I mentioned that Federal Government will develop strategies and policies that will protect lives while preserving livelihoods.
yor: 31.Nínú ọ̀rọ̀ àsọkẹ́yìn, mo ní ìjọba àpapọ yóò ṣàgbékalẹ̀ ète àti òfin tí yóò dáàbòbò è̩mí á sì ló̩ràá ìgbé-ayé.
mt0: <pad> 31. Ni ìwé mi títóó, mo ti sọ pé Federal Government yoo ṣe àwọn ìlànà àti àwọn ìlànà tó lè gbàyè sílẹ̀ nígbàtí o ń sàfihàn àwọn ẹmi àti àwọn ọ̀nà tí yóò gbàyè sílẹ̀.</s>

en: 32. In these two weeks, the Federal and State Governments have jointly and collaboratively worked hard on how to balance the need to protect health while also preserving livelihoods, leveraging global best practices while keeping in mind our peculiar circumstances.
yor: 32.Láàrín ọ̀sẹ̀ méjì yìí, ìjọba àpapọ àti ìpínlẹ̀ ti ṣiṣẹ́ takuntakun papọ̀ lóríi ọ̀nà láti ṣe ìdó̩ó̩gba dídábòòbò ìlera àti tító̩jú ìgbé ayé, ní ìdó̩gba pẹ̀lu bí wọ́n ti ń ṣe ní gbàáyé pẹ̀lu ìrántí awon ohun ìyàtọ̀ wa.
mt0: <pad> 32 Ni ọsẹ meji yii, Ajọba Federal ati Ajọba Ipinle ti ṣiṣẹ ni ọna ti o dara lati ṣe idapo awọn ohun ti o yẹ ki o daabo bo awọn igbesi aye lakoko ti o ba n daabo bo awọn ọrọ-ọrọ, lilo awọn ilana ti o dara julọ ni agbaye ati ṣiṣe akiyesi awọn ipo wa pẹlu.</s>

en: 33. We assessed how our factories, markets, traders and transporters can continue to function while at the same time adhering to NCDC guidelines on hygiene and social distancing.
yor: 33.A ṣàgbéyẹ̀wò bí àwọn ilé-iṣẹ, ọjà, oníṣòwò àti àwọn awakọ̀ wa ṣe leè tèsíwájú nínú ṣiṣẹ́ bákan náà kí wọ́n tèlé ìlànà àjo̩ amójútó ààrùn lórílèèdè yìí làkalè̩ lórí ìmó̩tótó àti jíjìnnà síra e̩ni.
mt0: <pad> Ìyá ìyá ò mọ́.</s>

en: 34. We assessed how our children can continue to learn without compromising their health.
yor: 34.A ṣe àgbéyẹ̀wò ìtẹ̀síwájú ìké̩kò̩ó̩ àwo̩n o̩mo̩ wa láì s̩e àkóbá ìlera wo̩n.
mt0: <pad> Ìyàtọ̀ ìsègùn ní ìgbà tí o bá lè sọ pé òun kò mọ́ 34. A ṣe ìwádìí bí àwọn ọmọ wa lè tẹ́siwaju láti kọ́ ìwé àti ìdánwò àlàyé wọn láìsí ìbámu àti ilera wọn.</s>

en: 35. We reviewed how our farmers can safely plant and harvest in this rainy season to ensure our food security is not compromised. Furthermore, we also discussed how to safely transport food items from rural production areas to industrial processing zones and ultimately, to the key consumption centres.
yor: 35. A yiiri ò̩nà tí àwo̩n àgbè̩ wa s̩e lè gbìn kí wó̩n sì kórè ní àkókò òjò kí á lè rip é ìpèsè oúnje̩ kò ní àkóbá. Síwájú sí, a tún sò̩rò̩ lóri ìgbóúnje̩ aláìléwu láti ìgbèríko lo̩ sí àwo̩n ilé-iṣẹ́ ìs̩ááyan rẹ̀ àti ibùdó ìje̩un gbòógì.
mt0: <pad> 35 We reviewed how our farmers can safely plant and harvest in this rainy season to ensure our food security is not compromised. Furthermore, we also discussed how to safely transport food items from rural production areas to industrial processing zones and ultimately, to the key consumption centres.</s>

en: 36. Our goal was to develop implementable policies that will ensure our economy continues to function while still maintaining our aggressive response to the COVID-19 pandemic. These same difficult decisions are being faced by leaders around the world.
yor: 36.Àfojúsùn wa ni ká wá ò̩nà tá á lò ti yóò jé̩ kí o̩rò̩ ajé wa máa tè̩síwájú nígbà tí à ń wá ìdáhùn atè̩wò̩n sájàákálè̩ ààrùn kòrónà. Ìpinnu líle yìí làwo̩n olórí gbogbo lágbàááyé ń dojúko̩.
mt0: <pad> Ìyàtọ̀ wa ni láti ṣe ìlànà tó lè jẹ́ kí ọrọ̀ ajé wa tẹ́siwajú ṣùgbọ́n o sì ní ìgbésí ìdáhùn àwọn ọlọ́lá lórí COVID-19. Àwọn ìpinnu ìṣòro wọ̀nyí ni a ń sẹ́ nípasè àwọn ọlọ́lá gbogbo ilẹ̀ ayé.</s>

en: 37. Based on the above and in line with the recommendations of the Presidential Task Force on COVID-19, the various Federal Government committees that have reviewed socio-economic matters and the Nigeria Governors Forum, I have approved a phased and gradual easing of lockdown measures in FCT, Lagos and Ogun States effective from Monday, 4th May, 2020.
yor: 37.Nítorí èyí àti ìyànjú àwọn ikọ̀ ààrẹ lórí COVID-19, orísirísi ìgbìmọ̀ ìjọba àpapọ tó ti gbé ọ̀rọ̀ ìsúnná yẹ̀wò àti ìgbìmọ̀ àwọn gómìnà Nàìjíríà, mo ti fọwọ́ sí kí òfin kónílé-gbélé nílùú Àbújá, Èkó, àti ìpínlẹ̀ Ògùn kí ó máa lọlẹ̀ díẹ̀díẹ̀ kí ó sì bè̩rè̩ láti ọjọ́ ajé, ọjọ́ kẹrin, oṣù karùn-ún, 2020.
mt0: <pad> 37 Based on the above and in line with the recommendations of the Presidential Task Force on COVID-19, the various Federal Government committees that have reviewed socio-economic matters and the Nigeria Governors Forum, I have approved a phased and gradual easing of lockdown measures in FCT, Lagos and Ogun States effective from Monday, 4th May, 2020, starting from Monday, 4th May, 2020.</s>

en: 38. However, this will be followed strictly with aggressive reinforcement of testing and contact tracing measures while allowing the restoration of some economic and business activities in certain sectors.
yor: 38.Síbè̩, àyè̩wò s̩is̩é àti s̩ís̩àwárí àwo̩n alábàápàdé alárùn kòrónà yóò máa lo̩ ní kánkán, a ó sì mú ìpadàbòsípò bá ètò ọrọ̀ ajé àtokòòwò láwo̩n ibì kan.
mt0: <pad> 38 However, this will be followed strictly with aggressive reinforcement of tests and contact tracing measures while allowing the restoration of some economic and business activities in certain sectors.</s>

en: 39. Furthermore, new nationwide measures are to be introduced as follows;
yor: 39.Síwájú síi, òfin tuntun táa s̩àgbékalè̩ káàkiri orílèèdè nìwọ̀nyí;
mt0: <pad> 39. In addition, new national measures are to be introduced as follows:</s>

en: a. There will be an overnight curfew from 8pm to 6am. This means all movements will be prohibited during this period except for essential services;
yor: a.Àkókò àìjáde wà láti 8am si 6am. Èyí túmọ̀ sí wípé rírìn káàkiri yóò di èèwọ̀ láàrin àkókò yìí àfi àwọn òs̩ìs̩é̩ pàtàkì.
mt0: <pad> Awọn ìgbà ọjọ́ ìṣẹ́jú mẹ́wáá àti mẹ́wáá ni a ti sọ̀rọ̀. Eyi tumo si gbogbo ìrìnnà ni a ti yímọ̀ ní àkókò náà, àti pé gbogbo ìrìnnà ni a ti yímọ̀ lẹ́yìn iṣẹ́ ìṣé ìdánwò.</s>

en: b. There will be a ban on non-essential inter-state passenger travel until further notice;
yor: b.Kò ní sááyè fún ìrìnàjò aláìs̩epàtàkì láarin ìpínlẹ̀síìpínlẹ̀ títí di àkókò àìmò̩.
mt0: <pad> b. A ti yọwọ si irin-ajo awọn ọkọ oju-omi gbogbogbo laarin ipinlẹ meji titi di igba keji.</s>

en: c. Partial and controlled interstate movement of goods and services will be allowed for the movement of goods and services from producers to consumers; and
yor: c.Gbígbé ẹrù alámòójútó láàrin ìpínlẹ̣̀síìpínlẹ̀ yóò wà díẹ̀ láti leè máa gbé àwọn ẹrù láti ilé-iṣé lọ sọ́dọ̀ àwọn tí yóò lò wọn.
mt0: <pad> c. A partial and controlled interstate movement of goods and services will be allowed for the movement of goods and services from producers to consumers;</s>

en: d. We will strictly ensure the mandatory use of face masks or coverings in public in addition to maintaining physical distancing and personal hygiene. Furthermore, the restrictions on social and religious gatherings shall remain in place. State Governments, corporate organisations and philanthropists are encouraged to support the production of cloth masks for citizens.
yor: d.A ó ri dájú wípé a fi dandan sí lílo ìbòjú ní ìta pẹ̀lú bí a ṣe ń fi ààyè sáàrín ara wa àti ìmọ́tótó. Ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀, àwọn onílé iṣẹ́ ńlá àti àwọn ẹlẹ́yinjú àánú la rọ̀ láti ṣe ìrànwọ ní pípèsè àwọn aso ìbòmú fún àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè yí.
mt0: <pad> a ti n ṣe ìdánwò nípa àwọn ìṣòro ìjọba, àti àwọn ìgbéjáde ẹ̀sìn àti ẹ̀sìn ìdúró.</s>

en: 40. For the avoidance of doubt, the lockdown in the FCT, Lagos and Ogun States shall remain in place until these new ones come into effect on Monday, 4th May 2020.
yor: 40.Nítorí iyèméjì, òfin kónílé-gbélé nílùú Àbújá, ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó àti Ògùn yóò wà títí di ìgbà tí àwọn òfin mìíràn yóó fi bẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀ lỌ́jọ́ ajé, ọjọ́ kẹrin oṣù karùn-ún, 2020.
mt0: <pad> 40. To avoid doubt, the lockdown in the FCT, Lagos and Ogun States will remain in place until these new ones come into effect on Monday, 4th May 2020.</s>

en: 41. The Presidential Task Force shall provide sector specific details to allow for preparations by Governments, businesses and institutions.
yor: 41.Àwọn ikọ̀ ààrẹ yóò pèsè àwọn àlàyé kan fún ìmúra sílẹ̀ ìjọba, àwọn olókoòwò àti ilé iṣẹ́.
mt0: <pad> Ìyàtọ̀ ìgbéjáde nípa ìlú kọ́ọ̀kan jẹ́ kí àwọn ìjọba, àwọn ilé iṣẹ́ àti àwọn ilé ìwé ṣe ìsètò.</s>

en: 42. In respect to the above guidelines, State Governors may choose to adapt and expand based on their unique circumstances provided they maintain alignment with the guidelines issued above.
yor: 42.Níbàámu àwọn ìlànà òkè wò̩nyí, ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ leè yàn láti faramọ́ àti láti fẹ̀ẹ́ lójú sii lórí onírúurú ìs̩è̩lè̩ àrò̩ò̩tò̩ tó bá súyo̩ kí wọ́n sáà ti wà níbàámu pẹ̀lú ìlànà àgbékalè̩ yìí.
mt0: <pad> Ṣe o mọ awọn ilana ti o wa loke?</s>

en: 43. To support our businesses and traders, the monetary and fiscal authorities shall deploy all the necessary provisions needed for production to continue and thus, jobs restored.
yor: 43.Láti s̩èrànwó fún olókoòwò àtàwọn ọlọ́jà wa, àwọn tó wà nídìí owó yóò darí ìpèsè tó yẹ kíṣẹ́ leè tẹ̀síwájú, ká sì múṣẹ́ padàbò̩ sípò.
mt0: <pad> 43. To support our businesses and traders, the monetary and fiscal authorities should deploy all the necessary provisions needed for production to continue and thus, jobs restored.</s>

en: 44. These revised guidelines will not apply to Kano State.
yor: 44.Àwọn ìlànà wọ̀nyí kò ní kan ìpínlẹ̀ Kano.
mt0: <pad> 44 These revised guidelines will not apply to Kano State.</s>

en: 45. With regards to Kano, I have directed the enforcement of a total lockdown for a period of two weeks effective immediately. The Federal Government shall deploy all the necessary human, material and technical resources to support the State in controlling and containing the pandemic and preventing the risk of further spread to neighboring States.
yor: 45.Níti ìpínlẹ̀ Kano, mo ti pàṣẹ kónílé-gbélé pátápátá fún òṣẹ̀ méjì ní kíákíá. Ìjọba àpapọ̀ yóò kó àwọn ènìyàn, ohun èlò àti àwọn irinṣẹ́ tí wọ́n nílò láti ran ìpínlẹ̀ náà lọ́wọ́ ní kíkápá àti bíborí àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn kòrónà yìí pè̩lú dídènà rè̩ láti máa ràn lọ sí àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ tó múlé tìí.
mt0: <pad> 45 About Kano, I have directed the implementation of a total lockdown for two weeks effective immediately. The Federal Government will deploy all the necessary human, material and technical resources to support the State in controlling and containing the pandemic and preventing the risk of further spread to neighboring States.</s>

en: 46. I wish to once again, commend the frontline workers across the country who, on a daily basis, risk everything to ensure we win this fight. For those who got infected in the line of duty, rest assured that Government will do all it takes to support you and your families during this exceedingly difficult period. I will also take this opportunity to assure you all that your safety, wellbeing and welfare remain paramount to our Government.
yor: 46.Léèkan si, mo fẹ́ káwọn òṣìṣẹ́ tó ń léwájú jákèjádò orílèèdè yìí, àwọn tí wọ́n ń fi ohun gbogbo wéwu lójojúmọ́ láti borí ìjà yìí. Sáwọn tó kó ààrùn lójú iṣẹ́ wọn, ẹ fọkànbalẹ̀ wípé ìjọba yóò ṣohun gbogbo tó gbà láti ràn ẹ̀yin àti ẹbí yín lọ́wọ́ lákòókò tó le rékọjá yìí. Mo tún fẹ́ lo àǹfàní yìí láti fi dáa yín lójú wípé ààbò àti ìgbé-ayé àlàáfíà yín ló jẹ ìjọba yìí lógún.
mt0: <pad> 46 I wanna again, commend the frontline workers across the country who, on a daily basis, risk everything to ensure we win this fight. For those who got infected in the line of duty, rest assured that Government will do all it takes to support you and your families during this exceedingly difficult period. I will also take this opportunity to assure you all that your safety, wellbeing and welfare remain paramount to our Government.</s>

en: 47. I will also recognize the support we have received from our traditional rulers, the Christian Association of Nigeria, the Nigerian Supreme Council for Islamic Affairs and other prominent religious and community leaders. Your cooperation and support have significantly contributed to the successes we have recorded to date.
yor: 47.Mo tún mo rírì àtìlẹyìn ta ti rígbà láti ọ̀dọ̀ àwọn Ọba wa, àwọn ẹgbẹ́ ọmọlẹ́yìn Krístì ní Nàìjíríà, àjọ tó gajù tó ń rí sí Islam àti àwọn àjọ ẹlẹ́sìn pẹ̀lú àwọn olórí agbègbè. Ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ àti àtìlẹyìn yín  ti ran àseyọrí tí a ní lọ́wó
mt0: <pad> 47 I will also recognize the support we have received from our traditional rulers, the Christian Association of Nigeria, the Nigerian Supreme Council for Islamic Affairs and other prominent religious and community leaders. Your cooperation and support have significantly contributed to the successes we have recorded to date.</s>

en: 48. I will urge you all to please continue to create awareness on the seriousness of the coronavirus among your worshippers and communities while appealing that they strictly comply with public health advisories.
yor: 48.Màá rọ gbogbo yín láti jọ̀wọ́ tẹ̀síwájú láti máa sọ̀rọ̀ lórí ààrùn Kòrónà ní àárín àwọn olùjọ́sìn àti àwọn olùgbé agbègbè yín wípé kí wọ́n kíyèsí gbogbo ìmọ̀ràn àti ìmọ́tótó láwùjọ.
mt0: <pad> 48 I will urge you all to please continue to create awareness on the seriousness of coronavirus among your worshippers and communities while appealing that they strictly comply with public health advisories.</s>

en: 49. I also thank the Nigeria Governors’ Forum and the Presidential Task Force for all their hard work to date. Through this collaboration, I remain confident that success is achievable.
yor: 49.Mo dúpẹ̣́ lọ̣́wọ́ ẹ̣̣gbẹ̣́ àwọ̣n gómìnà, ikò̩ ìgbìmọ̀ ìjọba àpapọ̀ amójútó ààrùn COVID-19 fún iṣ̣ẹ́ ribiribi títí dòní. Pẹ̣̀lú ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ yìí, mo ní ìdánilójú pé, àseyọrí yóò wà.
mt0: <pad> 49. I also thank the Nigeria Governors’ Forum and the Presidential Task Force for all their hard work to date. Through this collaboration, I remain confident that success is achievable.</s>

en: 50. I also wish to thank corporate organizations, philanthropists, the UN system, the European Union, friendly nations, the media and other partners that have taken up the responsibility of supporting our response.
yor: 50.Mo tún fẹ́ dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ àwọ̣̣n ilé-iṣ̣ẹ́ ńlá, aláàánú, àjọ̣ ìṣ̣ọ̣̣kan àgbáyé, àjọ̣ aláwọ̀ funfun, ọ̣̀rẹ́ orílèèdè yìí, akọ̣̣ròyìn àtàwọ̣̣n olùrànlọ̣́wọ́ wa fún àtìlẹ́yìn tí wọ̣̣n ń ṣ̣̣e fún wa.
mt0: <pad> I also wish to thank corporate organizations, philanthropists, the UN system, the European Union, friendly nations, the media and other partners who have taken on the responsibility of supporting our response.</s>

en: 51. And finally, I will thank all Nigerians again for your patience and cooperation during this difficult and challenging period. I assure you that government shall continue to take all necessary measures to protect the lives and livelihoods of our citizens and residents.
yor: 51.Nípàárí, màá tún dúpẹ́ lọ̣́wọ́ gbogbo àwọ̣̣n ọ̣̣mọ̣ Nàìjíríà lé̩è̩kan si fún sùúrù àti ìfọ̣̣wọ̣́sowọ̣́pọ̀ lásìkò ìpèníjà yìí. Mo fi da yín lójú pé ìjọ̣̣ba yóò sa gbogbo ipá rẹ̀ láti gbégbèésẹ̀ nípa dídáàbò bò ẹ̀mí àtìwàláàyè gbogbo tonílé-tàlejò orílèèdè yìí.
mt0: <pad> 51 And finally, I will thank all Nigerians again for your patience and cooperation during this difficult and challenging period. I assure you that government will continue to take all necessary measures to protect the lives and livelihoods of our citizens and residents.</s>

en: 52. I thank you for listening and may God bless the Federal Republic of Nigeria
yor: 52.Mo dúpẹ́ pé ẹ fetí sílẹ̀ fún mi, kỌ̣lọ́run bùkún fún orílèèdè Nàìjíríà.
mt0: <pad> 52 I thank you for listening and may God bless the Federal Republic of Nigeria.</s>

en: --- Security of Nigerians remains a primary concern – President Buhari
yor: --- Ààbò ọ̣̣mọ̣ Nàìjíríà ló jẹ̣ mí lógún jùlọ – Ààrẹ Buhari
mt0: <pad> Ìsàlẹ̀ ìlú ní ìlú Nigeria jẹ́ ìyàtọ̀ akọkọ́ - Buhari</s>

en: The Nigerian President, Muhammadu Buhari has stated that the safety and security of Nigerians remains a primary concern of his administration “especially in these difficult and uncertain times”.
yor: Ààrẹ orílèèdè Nàìjíríà, Muhammadu Buhari ti sọ pé ètò ààbò ọmọ orílèèdè Nàìjíríà ló jẹ òun lógún jùlọ "pàápàá jùlọ̣ ní àsìkò tí ìpèníjà àti àìròtẹ́lẹ̀ wọ̀nyí wà".
mt0: <pad> Muhammadu Buhari, àwọn ìlú Nigerian, ti sọ pé àlàáfíà àti ààbò àwọn ọmọ ilé iṣẹ́ rẹ̀ jẹ́ ìfẹ́ akọkọ́ rẹ̀ “pàápàá ni àwọn ìgbà yìí tí o níra àti ìbámu”.</s>

en: The President stated this in his nationwide broadcast to Nigerians on Monday the 27th of April, 2020.
yor: Ààrẹ̣ sọ̀yí lórí te̩lifís̩àn lásìkò tó ń bá ọ̣̣mọ̣ Nàìjíríà sọ̣̀rọ̀ lọ̣́jọ́ Ajé, 27th of April, 2020.
mt0: <pad> Olori orile-ede naa ti sọ eyi ni ọjọ́ ìṣẹ́gun, ọjọ́ kẹta oṣù kẹrin ọdun 2020, ní àwọn ìgbìmọ̀ rẹ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn ará Nigeria.</s>

en: President Buhari stated that even as his administration focuses on protecting lives and properties, it would not tolerate any human rights abuse by security agencies.
yor: Ààrẹ Buhari níjọ̀ó̩ba òun rí sáàbò ẹ̣̀mí àti dúkìá àwọ̣̣n ènìyàn, ìjọba òun kò sì ní fààyè gba ìwà títẹ̣ ẹ̣̀tọ́ọ̣̣́mọ̣̣nìyàn lójú látọ̣wọ́ àwọ̣̣n agbófinró.
mt0: <pad> President Buhari said that while his administration is focusing on protecting lives and properties, it will not tolerate any human rights abuses by security agencies.</s>

en: “The few reported incidences are regrettable, and I want to assure you that the culprits will be brought to justice,” the President vowed.
yor: "Ìròyìn tí mo gbọ́ banújẹ́ lọ̣̣́pọ̣̀lọ̣̣pọ̣̀, mo fi ń dá ọmọ orílèèdè Nàìjíríà lójú pé, àwọn ẹ̣̣lẹ̣́sẹ̀ kò ní lọ̣ láìjìyà lábẹ́ òfin."
mt0: <pad> “The few incidents reported are regrettable, and I want to assure you that the culprits will be brought to justice,” the President vowed.</s>

en: The President urged Nigerians to continue to cooperate and show understanding whenever they encounter security agents.
yor: Ààrẹ wá rọ̣ gbogbo ọ̣̣mọ̣ orílèèdè Nàìjíríà láti fọ̣̣wọ̣́sowọ̣́pọ̣̀ pẹ̣̣̀lú àwọ̣̣n agbófinró lásìkò ìpàdé pè̩lú wọ̣̣n.
mt0: <pad> Oluwakemi Adekunle called on Nigerians to continue to cooperate and show understanding whenever they encounter security agents.</s>

en: --- COVID-19: President Buhari orders total lockdown of Kano
yor: --- COVID-19: Ààrẹ Buhari pàṣ̣ẹ ètò kónílé-gbélé nípìnínlẹ̀ Kánò
mt0: <pad> COVID-19: President Buhari orders total lockdown of Kano state</s>

en: Nigerian President Muhammadu Buhari has ordered the total lockdown of Kano State North West Nigeria following the mysterious deaths recorded in the state.
yor: Ààrẹ̣ Nàìjíríà, Muhammadu Buhari ti pàṣ̣ẹ kétò kónílé-gbélé bẹ̣̀rẹ̀ nípìnínlẹ̀ Kánò, Àríwá Ìwọ̣̀-Oòrùn Nàìjíríà látàrí báwọ̣̣n ènìyàn se ń kúkú òjijì nípìnínlẹ̀ náà.
mt0: <pad> Òàì òó íà ñâîé íà ñòðàõàëè íà Kano State North West Nigeria following the mysterious deaths recorded in the state.</s>

en: The President who announced this in a nationwide broadcast added that the lockdown would be in place for two weeks with immediate effect.
yor: Ààrẹ Buhari so̩ ọ̣̀rọ̣̀ yíi lórí ẹ̣̀rọ̣ a-móhùn-máwòrán pé ètò kónílé-gbélé ọ̣̀hún yóò wà fún ọ̣̀sẹ̀ méjì gbáko ní kánkán, ní ìpínlẹ̣̀ Kánò.
mt0: <pad> Olori orile-ede ti o kede eyi ni afefe gbogbo ilu, sọ pe lockdown yoo wa fun ọsẹ meji pẹlu ibẹrẹ lẹsẹkẹsẹ.</s>

en: “The Federal Government shall deploy all the necessary human, material and technical resources to support the State in controlling and containing the pandemic and preventing the risk of further spread to neighboring States” President Buhari stated.
yor: Ààrẹ̣ tún sọ̣ pé "Ìjọ̣̣ba àpapọ̀ yóò fàwọ̣̣n irinṣ̣ẹ́ àti òṣ̣ìṣ̣ẹ́ ránsẹ́ sí ìpínlẹ̀ Kánò láti ran ìpínlẹ̀ ọ̀hún lọ̣́wọ̣́, lọ̣́nà àtidẹ̣́kun ààrùn Kòrónà, kó má baà tàn lọ̣ sí ìpínlẹ̀ mìíràn tó sún mọ́ wọ̣̣n."
mt0: <pad> “The Federal Government will deploy all the necessary human, material and technical resources to support the State in controlling and containing the pandemic and preventing the risk of further spread to neighboring States” President Buhari stated.</s>

en: He explained that preliminary findings in Kano and other states show that new cases are mostly from interstate travel and emerging community transmission,
yor: Ààrẹ̣ tún sọ̣ pé àwọ̣̣n arìnrìnàjò láti ìpínlẹ̀ kan lọ̣ sí ìpínlẹ̀ mìíràn ló fa ìtànkálẹ̀ ààrùn tí ó wáyé ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kánò.
mt0: <pad> Òun sọ pé àwọn ìwádìí akọkọ ni Kano àti àwọn ipinlẹ miiran fi hàn pé àwọn ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ tuntun jẹ́ nípa irin-ajo àti ìsìnkú agbègbè.</s>

en: --- NIS receives 13 Nigerian returnees from Togo
yor: --- NIS gbo̩mọ̣̣̣̣ Nàìjíríà mẹ́tàlá tó ń ti Tógò bò̩
mt0: <pad> NIS receives 13 Nigerian returnees from Togo</s>

en: The Nigeria Immigration Service (NIS) says it had received 13 Nigerians that arrived from Lome, Togo at Seme-Krake joint border post.
yor: Ile-iṣ̣ẹ́ amójútó arìnrìnàjò Nàìjíríà (NIS) ní àwọ̣̣n ọ̣̣mọ̣ orílèèdè yìí mẹ́tàlá làwọ̣̣n ti rí gbà láti orílèèdè Lòmè, Tógò àti Seme-Krake.
mt0: <pad> Nigeria Immigration Service (NIS) says it had received 13 Nigerians who arrived from Lome, Togo at Seme-Krake joint border post.</s>

en: The Spokesman, NIS, Mr Sunday James who disclosed this in a statement on Sunday in Abuja said that the returnees were technicians that went to install Industrial Machines in Togo.
yor: Agbẹnusọ̣ NIS náà, ọ̣̀gbẹ́ni Sunday James ló sọ̣̣̀yí nínú àtẹ̣̀jáde kan lọ̣́jọ́ Àìkú nílùú Àbújá, láwọ̣̣n tó padà wá sílé jẹ́ akọ́sẹ́mọsẹ́ tí wọ̣̣n lọ̣ ṣ̣iṣ̣ẹ́ nílées̩ẹ́ kan ni Tógò.
mt0: <pad> Ẹ̀yìn ìlú àtijọ́, NIS, Mr Sunday James, nínú ìjábọ̀ rẹ̀ lọ́jọ́ kan ní Abuja sọ pé àwọn èrò ìgbéjáde náà ni àwọn ẹlẹ́kọ̀ọ́ tí wọ́n lọ́ láti ṣe àwọn ẹrọ ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣàkóso ìṣ

en: According to James, the 13 returnees have been handed over to officials of the Ministry of Health in Lagos for medical test.
yor: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọ̣̀gbẹ́ni James ṣ̣e ṣ̣ọ, ó làwọ̣̣n ènìyàn mẹ́tàlá ọ̣̀hún ni wọ̣́n ti fà fún eléètò ìlera Èkó fún àyẹ̣̀wò Corona.
mt0: <pad> According to James, the 13 returnees have been handed over to officials of the Ministry of Health in Lagos for medical test.</s>

en: “Also for isolation in line with NCDC directives on medical procedures for new arrivals into the country to curtail the spread of Corona Virus,” he said.
yor: Ó ní, "Bákan náà la tún sọ̣ fún wọ̣̣n pé kí wọ̣̣́n wà nígbèèélé gẹ́gẹ́ bílànà àjọ̣ agbógun tàjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn (NCDC) ṣ̣̣e làá sílẹ̀ fún àwọ̣̣n tí wọ̣́n bá ṣ̣ẹ̣̀ṣẹ̀ dé láti ilẹ̀ òkèèrè, lèyí láti dẹ́kun ààrùn Corona."
mt0: <pad> “Also for isolation in line with NCDC directives on medical procedures for new arrivals into the country to curtail the spread of Corona Virus,” he said.</s>

en: James said that Seme-Krake was a major entry-exit point into and out of Nigeria, bordering Benin Republic, adding that NIS was not taking chances in enforcing strict border patrol.
yor: James lẹ́nubodè Seme-Krake jẹ́ ojú ọ̀nà tó gba Nàìjíríà wọ̣̣lé tàbí jáde, tó sì tún pààlà pẹ̀lú orílèèdè Benin. Ó ní NIS kò káàrẹ́ láti mójútó àwọ̣̣n ẹ̣nubodè wọ̀nyí.
mt0: <pad> James said Seme-Krake was a major entry-exit point into and out of Nigeria, bordering Benin Republic, adding that NIS was not taking chances in enforcing strict border patrol, adding that NIS was not taking chances in enforcing strict border patrol.</s>

en: He said that the service would apprehend anyone that wanted to circumvent the approved routes, hence the numbers that have been turning up through the Seme-Krake border post since the border closure.
yor: Ó ní NIS máa mú àwọ̣̣̣n tí ó bá fẹ́ gba ọ̀nà ẹ̀bùrú láti wọ̣̣̣lé sí orílè̩ èdè Nàìjíríà, nítorí náà iye àwo̩n tó ń gba e̩nu ibodè Seme-Krake ti peléke si.
mt0: <pad> O sọ pe awọn ọlọpa yoo mu ẹnikẹni ti o ba fẹ lati kọja awọn ọna ti a gba laaye, nitorinaa awọn nọmba ti o ti n wọle nipasẹ Seme-Krake border post lati igba ti a ti ṣe idajọ lori awọn ọrọ ijabọ.</s>

en: He said that the NIS Comptroller General, Mr Muhammad Babandede has advised the returnees to avoid following bush paths to avoid the experience of suffering in the hands of criminals in an effort to follow unrecognized routes risking.
yor: Ó ní adarí NIS gbogboòògbò, ìye̩n ọ̀gbẹ́ni Muhammad Bàbándédè ti rọ̣ àwọ̣̣n arìnrìnàjò tó ń padabò̩ wá sí orílèèdè Nàìjíríà láti ṣ̣ọ̣́ra nípa gbígba ọ̀nà ẹ̀bùrú, nítorí àwọ̣n ọ̀daràn àti oníṣẹ́-ibi tí ó leè ṣe wọ̣̣̣́n ní ìjàmbá.
mt0: <pad> Òun sọ pé, NIS Comptroller General, Mr Muhammad Babandede ti sọ fun àwọn ìgbéjáde láti ma tẹ̀lé ọ̀nà bush láti yẹra fún ìrírí ìṣẹ́gun nínú ọwọ́ àwọn ẹlẹ́ṣẹ́ ní ìfẹ̀sí láti yẹra fún ìrírí ìṣẹ́gun nínú ọwọ́ àwọn ẹlẹ́ṣẹ́ ní ìfẹ̀sí láti tẹ̀lé ọ̀nà tí kò mọ̀ lọ́nà láti yẹra fún ìrírí ìṣẹ́gun nínú ọwọ́ àwọn ẹlẹ́ṣẹ́.</s>

en: --- President Buhari to address the nation at 19:00hrs GMT
yor: --- Ààrẹ Buhari yóò bọ́mọ orílèèdè sọ̀rọ̀ lágogo mẹ́jọ àsálẹ́.
mt0: <pad> President Buhari to address the nation at 19:00hrs GMT on Wednesday.</s>

en: President Muhammadu Buhari will address the nation today  Monday, April 27, at 19:00hrs GMT (8pm local time).
yor: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari yóò bá o̩mo̩ orílèèdè Nàìjíríà sọ̣̀rọ̣̀ lónìí Mó̩ńdè, April 27, ni aago mé̩jo̩ alé̩.

en: Television, radio and other electronic media stations are enjoined to hook up to the network services of the Nigerian Television Authority (NTA) and Federal Radio Corporation of Nigeria (FRCN) respectively for the broadcast.

yor: Ààrẹ Nàìjíríà, Muhammadu Buhari yóò máa bá orílèèdè Nàìjíríà sọ̣̀rọ̣̀ lónìí yìí, Monday, April 27, 2020 ni 8pm.

en: --- Reps to resume plenary April 28
yor: --- Ilé-ìgbìmọ̀ aṣ̣ojú yóò padà sẹ̣́nusẹ́ ní April 28
mt0: <pad> Òun kò mọ́.</s>

en: The Nigerian House of Representatives is to resume plenary on Tuesday after over one month suspension over the Covid-19 pandemic in the country.
yor: Ilé-ìgbìmọ̀ aṣ̣ojú Nàìjíríà yóò padà ṣ̣ẹ̣́nuṣ̣ẹ́ ló̩jó̩ ìs̩e̩gun lẹ̣́yìn ìsinmi oṣ̣̣ù kan tí wọ̣́n wà látàrí ààrùn Covid-19 tó ṣ̣ẹ̣̣lẹ̀ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.
mt0: <pad> Òun kò mọ̀</s>

en: The Lawmakers had on March 24th suspended plenary for two weeks to allow the management of the National Assembly put safety measures that would prevent the spread of the deadly disease in the Complex, but one week later government impose a lock down on Abuja the Nation’s capital and two other States, worst hit by the disease to curb its spread.
yor: Lọ̣́jọ́ kẹ̣̣rìnlélógún, oṣ̣ù kẹ̣̣ta nilé ìgbìmọ̀ asojú kọ́kọ́ bẹ̣̣̀rẹ̀ ìsinmi ọlọ́sẹ̀ méjì wọ̣́n láti leè jẹ́ kígbìmọ̀ tó ń mójútó ilé –asòfin pèsè ààbò tó múnádóko tí yóò dẹ̣́kun ìtànkálẹ̀ ààrùn COIVD-19 nilé-asòfin ọ̀hún sùgbọ̣́n lẹ̣́yìn ọ̣̀sẹ̀ kan tí wọ́n bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìsinmi nìjọba àpapọ̀ pàsẹ pé kí ètò kónílé-gbélé bẹ̣̀rẹ̀ nílùú Àbújá àtàwọ̣n ìpínlẹ̀ méjì táàrùn COIVD-19 ń bá wọ̀yá ìjà.
mt0: <pad> Òun kò mọ̀</s>

en: A statement from the Clerk to the House of Representatives, Mr. Patrick Giwa advised members to take note and abide by the Covid-19 Guidelines approved by the Federal Government and the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) and additional Guidelines developed by the House which will be sent to Members.
yor: Nínú àtẹ̀jáde kan tákọ̀wé ilé-ìgbìmọ̀ asojú ọ̀hún, ọ̀gbẹ́ni Patrick Gíwá gbéjáde láti gbàwọ̣̣n ọ̣̣mọ̣̣ ìgbìmọ̀ aṣ̣ojú náà nímọ̀ràn láti tẹ̣̣̀lé ètò ìlànà tíjọ̣̣ba àpapọ̀ àtàjọ̣̣ tó ń gbógun tàjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn ní Nàìjíríà là sílẹ̀ àtètò ìlànà tílé-ìgbìmọ̀ aṣ̣ojú làà sílẹ̀, léyìí táwọ̣̣n yóò fi ránṣ̣ẹ́ sáwọ̣̣n ọ̣̣mọ̣̣ ilé-ìgbìmọ̀ asojú ọ̣̣̀hún.
mt0: <pad> Ìwé ìjábọ̀ láti ọ́gbẹ́ni àwọn òṣèlú, Patrick Giwa sọ pé kí wọ́n tẹ́lé àwọn ìlànà Covid-19 tí a ti gba nípasẹ̀ àjọ àti àwọn ìlànà tí a ti ṣe lọ́wọ́ nípasẹ̀ iléeṣẹ́ àlàyé àti àwọn ìlànà tí a ti ṣe lọ́wọ́ ní iléeṣẹ́ àlàyé.</s>

en: However the statement directed that Members’ aides and Staff of the National Assembly to work from home and “will be notified when needed in the office for any special assignment.”
yor: Àtẹ̣̣̀jáde náà ní káwọ̣̣n olùrànlọ̣̣́wọ̣̣́ àtòṣ̣ìṣ̣ẹ́ ilé-ìgbìmọ̀ aṣ̣òfin sì dúró sílé láti máa ṣ̣iṣ̣ẹ́ wọ̣̣n àti pé "a ó pè wọ̣̣́n ta bá nílò ìrànlọ́wọ́ wọ̣̣n fúnsẹ́ pàtàkì kan níléesẹ́."
mt0: <pad> However, the statement directed Members’ aides and Staff of the National Assembly to work from home and “will be notified when needed in the office for any special assignment.”</s>

en: On resumption, the lawmakers are expected to focus on measures to strengthen the fight against the pandemic as well as its impact on the Nation’s economy.
yor: Táwọ̣n ọ̣̣mọ̣̣ ilé –ìgbìmọ̀ aṣ̣ojú ọ̀hún bá wọ̣̣lé, wọ̣̣n yóò máa jíròrò lórí ìgbésẹ̀ láti gbógun ti ààrùn Corona àti lórí ètò ọ̣̀rọ̣̀ ajẹ́ orílèèdè yìí.
mt0: <pad> When they return, lawmakers are expected to focus on measures to strengthen the fight against the pandemic as well as its impact on the Nation’s economy.</s>

en: --- Federal government had been studying the case in Kano State- Minister
yor: --- Ìjọba àpapọ̣̣̀ ń ṣe ìwádìí alárùn kòrónà ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kánò- Mínísítà
mt0: <pad> - The Federal government had been studying the case in Kano State-</s>

en: Minister for health in Nigeria, Osagie Ehanire said the federal government and Kano state government had been studying the case in Kano State with their authorities, adding that the ministry would be sending high ranking fact finding missions there.
yor: Mínísítà fún ètò ìlera ní orílè̩ èdè Nàìjíríà, Osagie Ehanire, ti sọ pé ìjọ̣̣ba àpapọ̣̣̀ àti ìjọ̣̣ba ìpínlẹ̀ Kánò ti ń s̩e ìwádìí ní Kano pè̩lú às̩e̩ wo̩n, ó ní ilé-is̩é ò̩hún yóò rán àwo̩n adarí awérìí nínú ìwádìí.
mt0: <pad> Òṣèlú ilé ìwòsàn ni Nigeria, Osagie Ehanire said the federal government and Kano state government had been studying the case with their authorities, adding that the ministry would be sending high ranking fact finding missions there.</s>

en: Ehanire said that the fact finding mission would meet with the governor to be able to diagnose the situation, adding it was not really clear if they were COVID-19 related.
yor: Ehanire ní ikò̩ tó ń s̩is̩é̩ ìwé̩rìí nínú ìwádìí yóò ṣ̣e ìpàdé pẹ̣̣̀lú gómìnà Kánò láti so̩ irú ìs̩è̩lè̩ ọ̀hún, ó sì fi kún-un pé kò dájú pé kòrónà ni.
mt0: <pad> Ehanire said the fact finding mission would meet with the governor to be able to diagnose the situation, adding it was not really clear if they were COVID-19 related.</s>

en: Ehanire said that the fact finding mission would also looked at if there would be room for improvement in the state’s response activities on COVID-19, like surveillance, testing, case finding, contact tracing and isolation.
yor: Ehanire tún láwọ̣̣n ikọ̀ náà yóò máa ṣàyẹ̀wò, ìyàsọ̣́tọ̀, ìtọpinpin àwọ̣̣n alárùn ọ̀hún, láti mọ̀nà tí wọ̣̣n yóò gbà láti métò ìdàgbàsókè báwọ̣̣n ètò ìlànà àti yàrá àyẹ̀wò tó ti wá ní ìpínlẹ̀ náà.
mt0: <pad> Ehanire said that the fact finding mission would also look at if there would be room for improvement in the state’s response activities on COVID-19, like surveillance, testing, case finding, contact tracing and isolation.</s>

en: “Kano does not have experience with COVID-19 and the rate it has exploded should be of concern to all.
yor: "Kánò kò nírìírí nípa ààrùn COVID-19 tẹ̣́lẹ̣̀rí, ìyàlẹ̣̣́nu ló sì ye̩ kó jẹ́ fún wa báàrùn COVID-19 se tànkálẹ̀."
mt0: <pad> Kano kò ni ìmọ̀lẹ̀ nípa COVID-19 àti pé ìwọ̀n tí ó ti gbé soke gbọdọ̀ jẹ́ ìṣòro fún gbogbo.</s>

en: ”It is possible to be able to contain it, if the right processes are followed and the right resources are brought in.
yor: Ó se é se, kí a leè dẹ́kun ààrùn yìí tí a bá lo àwọ̣̣n irinṣẹ́ àti àwọ̣̣n ènìyàn tó múná-dóko.
mt0: <pad> ”O le ṣee ṣe lati jẹ ki o wa ni awọn ọna ti o tọ, ti a ba tẹle awọn ilana ti o tọ ati pe a ba mu awọn ohun elo ti o tọ wọle.</s>

en: The minister said Lagos which is more populated like Kano has efficient instruments and that Lagos state act fast in fighting corona virus because of the experience during Ebola crisis in 2014.
yor: Mínísítà ní Èkó tó lérò bíi ìpínlẹ̀ Kánò láwọ̣̣n irinṣ̣ẹ́ tó múnádóko àti pé ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó tètè dojúkọ̣̣ ààrùn Corona nítorí ìrírí tí wọ̣̣́n ní nípa ààrùn Èbólà tó ṣ̣ẹ̣̣lẹ̀ lọ́dún 2014.
mt0: <pad> Òun mọ̀ pé Lagos, tó ní àwọn ènìyàn púpọ̀ bí Kano, ni àwọn irinṣẹ́ ti o ṣiṣẹ́ lọ́tọ̀ àti pé Lagos ṣe ìgbésẹ̀ láti jà kòrórò nítorí ìrírí Ebola ní 2014.</s>

en: Minister continued that the materials and instrument that Kano state have, though  they are trying their best, Lagos state cannot be compared with Kano state, because the workers and the instrument that Lagos have, Kano does not have such.
yor: Mínísítà tẹ̣̣̀síwájú pé àwọ̣̣n èròjà àti irinṣ̣ẹ́ típìnínlẹ̀ Kánò ní, bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé wọ̣́n ń gbìyànju, a kò le fi ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó wé ìpínlẹ̀ Kánò, nítorí pé àwọ̣̣n òṣ̣ìṣ̣é àtirinṣ̣ẹ́ tí ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó ní, ìpínlẹ̀ Kánò kò níi.
mt0: <pad> Ohun ti o wa ni Kano state, awọn ohun elo ati ẹrọ ti o wa ni Kano state, awọn nkan ti o wa ni Lagos state, awọn nkan ti o wa ni Kano state, awọn nkan ti o wa ni Lagos state, Kano state does not have such.</s>

en: Ehanire said forty (40) health workers have been infected with corona virus in Nigeria, but they were not infected on duty.
yor: Ehanire ní ogójì òṣ̣ìṣ̣ẹ́ ètò ìlera ni wọ̣̣̣́n ti láárùn kòrónà ní Nàìjíríà, s̩ùgbó̩n ibi-is̩é̩ kó̩ ni wó̩n ti kó o.
mt0: <pad> Ehanire said forty (40) health workers have been infected with coronavirus in Nigeria, but they were not infected on duty.</s>
